title: Biologics Sales Specialist- Jersey City, NJ
description:
Are you an experienced Sales Professional looking to join a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? If you’re passionate about what science can do to make a difference to patients' lives and ready to discover what you can do – join us.


Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we believe we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. As a **Respiratory Biologics Sales Specialist** you'll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients' lives.


Building on a 50-year heritage in respiratory care, our ambition is to transform the treatment of asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) by driving earlier, biology-led treatment, eliminating preventable asthma attacks, and removing COPD as a top-three leading cause of death. Underpinning chronic lung diseases is an altered immune system. AstraZeneca is following the science of common pathways and underlying disease drivers from respiratory disease into immunology-driven disease areas.


At AstraZeneca, we are taking bold action on climate because we recognize the connection between healthy people and a healthy planet. As part of our flagship Ambition Zero Carbon program, we have committed to a fully electric vehicle (EV) fleet by the end of 2025, which means that all of our drivers will be assigned an EV.

**What you’ll do:**

* You will develop superior product and disease state knowledge and effectively educate and engage healthcare professionals in dialogue about clinical evidence, approved indications, and product efficacy/safety profiles to support on-label prescribing for Respiratory Biologics and appropriate patients.
* You will function independently with a high degree of sales proficiency to drive sales performance and ensure sales forecasts and assigned budgets meet or exceed therapeutic and territory expectations. You will successfully complete training requirements, including product examinations.
* You will capitalize on formulary approvals and other opportunities through effective implementation of the strategic targeting plans by using a wide variety of promotional, personnel resources and analytical tools to improve efficiency in assigned sales territory, based on local assessment of customer needs.
* You will pro-actively identify business opportunities, present value propositions aligned to stakeholder needs and objectives, and recommend solutions to drive and develop business.
* You will provide special education to healthcare providers through appropriate programs that fall within AstraZeneca's ethical guidelines. Work with other Respiratory Biologics Sales Specialists around common objectives to coordinate selling efforts and partner very closely with Field Reimbursement managers to ensure seemly delivery of our biologics medicines to our customers.
* You will be encouraged to consistently challenge yourself to grow and develop, you will ask for feedback in an effort to raise awareness and gain insight into one's strengths and developmental needs. You will collaborate across functional areas to drive positive outcomes that align to organizational objectives demonstrates AZ values, understands basic business principles and interprets resources available to make sound business decisions

**Essential Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree
* At least three years of documented, full-time, successful pharmaceutical/biotech sales AND/OR 3 yrs. experience in scientific/clinical/healthcare environment AND/OR 3 yrs. demonstrated experience & knowledge within healthcare ecosystems
* Track record of engaging key stakeholders in complex clinical environments (mid to senior level healthcare professionals, key accounts and the medical community)
* Proven demonstration of successful working in complex cross functional teams
* Strong scientific acumen in a highly competitive environment
* Strong understanding of the reimbursement and distribution challenges of a biologics product to take a strategic approach to capitalize on marketplace opportunities
* A valid driver's license and safe driving record
* Internal candidate must be a minimum of Career Level 2

**Desired Requirements:**

* Experience launching new products
* Respiratory, respiratory biologics, biologics or specialty care experience
* Proven experience and mastery in delivering a total office call
* Demonstrated effective time management, organizational and interpersonal skills to prioritize opportunities and execute flawlessly
* Demonstrated effective leadership, organization and communication skills
* Demonstrated judgment and decision-making capability
* Be results oriented with demonstrated time management skills
* Ability to learn, analyze, understand and convey complex information
* Internal candidate Career Level 3 is preferred

 *Please note - Relocation assistance is not available for this position.*

**Why AstraZeneca?**


At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together.
company_description: We are AstraZeneca, one of the world’s most forward-thinking and connected BioPharmaceutical companies.

title: Vice President of Data Engineering
description:
Title:
Vice President of Data Engineering
Company:
Everest Global Services, Inc.
Job Category:
Technology
Job Description:
About Everest:  

Everest Group, Ltd. (Everest), is a leading global reinsurance and insurance provider, operating for nearly 50 years through subsidiaries in North America, Latin America, the UK & Ireland, Continental Europe and Asia Pacific regions. Throughout our history, Everest has maintained its discipline and focuses on creating long-term value through underwriting excellence and strong risk and capital management. Our strengths include extensive product and distribution capabilities, a strong balance sheet, and an innovative culture. Our most critical asset is our people. We offer dynamic training & professional development to our employees. We also offer generous tuition/continuing education reimbursement programs, mentoring opportunities, flexible work arrangements, and Colleague Resource Groups.
Job Description:  

Everest is seeking a Vice President of Data Engineering to spearhead the execution of our Global Data Strategy. In this high-impact role, you will leverage your extensive technical expertise and leadership skills to collaborate with business counterparts, define strategic plans, and deliver innovative technical solutions that drive business outcomes and align with the company’s overarching strategy. As a senior leader, you will oversee multiple teams and serve as a key engineering leader across the organization.  

  

Key Responsibilities:* Strategic Collaboration: Partner with internal stakeholders to understand strategic analytics and business intelligence needs, translating them into technology requirements that support business objectives.
* Leadership in Technology: Lead the development and implementation of data and analytics technology strategies and roadmaps to enhance information management capabilities while adhering to established technology and architecture standards.
* Architectural Vision: Define and implement the data and analytics architecture, tools, and capabilities required for a modern, cloud-based data environment, establishing best practices, governance, and controls for broad enterprise adoption.
* Customer Experience: Ensure exceptional customer and partner experiences by providing seamless access to data and intuitive self-service capabilities, maintaining data security, integrity, and quality, and fostering an agile and scalable ecosystem.
* Advanced Analytics: Drive the rapid ingestion of new data and the timely deployment of advanced analytic models into production environments.
* Engineering Excellence: Promote the sharing, inner sourcing, and reuse of code, capabilities, and methods within a cloud-first environment, utilizing highly automated DevOps tools and practices.
* Transformation Leadership: Accelerate data and analytics transformation and cloud adoption, championing security, standards, governance, and best practices with a focus on data quality and integrity.
* Project Delivery: Oversee engagement and coordination across delivery teams to ensure high-quality project execution within scope, timeframe, and budget constraints.

  

Knowledge, Skills & Competencies:* Team Leadership: Demonstrated experience in building and managing high-performing teams, inspiring them to tackle new challenges and achieve outstanding results.
* Talent Management: Proven ability to attract, retain, and develop top talent, fostering a culture of excellence and clear, aligned communication.
* Data & Analytics Expertise: Extensive experience leading data and analytics organizations within complex, multinational environments, with a track record of successful project delivery.
* Influential Leadership: Inspirational leader with strong communication and relationship management skills, thriving in collaborative settings.
* Strategic Vision: Ability to craft and communicate a clear strategy and roadmap that aligns with business stakeholders’ expectations and drives delivery excellence.
* Hands-On Approach: Comfortable working in a flat, lean organization that values rolling up sleeves and delving into details.

  

Qualifications:* Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, business, or a related field.
* Industry Experience: Minimum of 10 years of experience in insurance or financial services.
* Technical Expertise: At least 8 years of experience in the data engineering space, with deep expertise in delivering enhanced analytic and data access capabilities.
* Leadership Experience: Over 5 years of experience in people leadership and management.
* Multinational Experience: Experience working in a large, multinational company is preferred.
* Technical Proficiency: Proficient in using the Azure technology stack (ADF, Data Bricks), cloud platforms, object-oriented programming (Python, SQL), and data engineering practices.

  

If you are a visionary leader with a passion for driving data engineering excellence and transformation, we invite you to apply for this senior role and contribute to the continued success of our organization.
Our Culture
At Everest, our purpose is to provide the world with protection. We help clients and businesses thrive, fuel global economies, and create sustainable value for our colleagues, shareholders and the communities that we serve. We also pride ourselves on having a unique and inclusive culture which is driven by a unified set of values and behaviors. Click here to learn more about our culture.* Our Values are the guiding principles that inform our decisions, actions and behaviors. They are an expression of our culture and an integral part of how we work: Talent. Thoughtful assumption of risk. Execution. Efficiency. Humility. Leadership. Collaboration. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion.
* Our Colleague Behaviors define how we operate and interact with each other no matter our location, level or function: Respect everyone. Pursue better. Lead by example. Own our outcomes. Win together.
  

All colleagues are held accountable to upholding and supporting our values and behaviors across the company. This includes day to day interactions with fellow colleagues, and the global communities we serve.
#LI-DP1
#LI-Hybrid
Type:
Regular
Time Type:
Full time
Primary Location:
Warren, NJ
Additional Locations:*Everest is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, genetics, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. As part of this commitment, Everest will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Everest Benefits at* *everestbenefits@everestglobal.com.*

title: Supervisor
description:
Free movies, free popcorn, flex schedules…and more! Assist management in the coordination of operations to achieve AMC’s goals. Model and communicate expectations to all associates in a professional and safe work environment.
**Benefit Summary**


Build strong communication, leadership, and time management skills at AMC, and take advantage of our opportunities for career advancement. AMC team members enjoy a very competitive benefits package including, medical/dental/vision coverage, 401(k) match, free popcorn daily, half off eats and drinks at the theatre, and most importantly for us movie people…FREE movies!
  

  

AMC’s company culture is focused on innovation and diversity to ensure that we provide the latest and greatest experience for our guests and associates. We lead by example in doing what is right and take responsibility for our own results and our company’s success.
**Job Description**


**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Six months of supervisory or commensurate leadership experience.
* One-year experience in guest-focused business (retail, restaurant, hospitality, etc.).
* Working knowledge of all theatre crew functions.
* Strong communication skills.
* Proficiency in MS Suite.
* Demonstrated ability to listen, communicate, and work effectively with guests, associates, and supervisors in a fast paced environment.
* Demonstrated ability to lead teams and consistently achieve results through resources.

 **ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Coordinate and coach theatre crew to perform the "essential functions" of their positions.
* Reinforce "Wardrobe 101" policy with theatre crew.
* Observe theatre crew performance and provide feedback to management for discipline and performance evaluations.
* Optimize theatre crew placement on a round-by-round basis.
* Lead teams and consistently achieve results through resources.
* Supervise, coach and coordinate theatre crew to execute and comply with Safe and Clean protocols.
* Perform daily operational and administrative duties as assigned.
* Oversee opening and closing procedures outside of operating hours (minus vault management).
* May begin opening procedures and/or finalize closing procedures.
* Provide access to vendors for repairs and deliveries outside of operating hours.
* Assist management with floor operations.
* Assign registers / distribute banks (box, concession, guest service, and arcade).
* Supply change, as needed.
* Maintain and reconcile floor safes.
* Pull and count cash, cash equivalents, and coupons from individual drawers and enter results into computer system.
* Prepare deposits and banks.
* Accurately complete appropriate cash handling forms; maintain and balance cash handling fund.
* Perform daily opening, closing, operational, and administrative duties.
* Assist in the preparation of the *theatre crew schedule* with final weekly document approval from a manager.
* Participate in the daily inventory processes.
* Open tickets for system support issues and follow-up for resolution.
* Resolve guest questions, concerns, and issues.
* Research guest issues related to AMC Stubs and credit card refund authorizations.
* Distribute and reconcile passes.
* Listen, communicate, and work effectively with guests, associates, and supervisors in a fast-paced environment.
* Maintain regular personal attendance for all scheduled shifts to ensure timely performance of duties.
* Uphold AMC's *Business Practice Standards* and ensure compliance with company programs.
* Ability to work and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
* Perform other duties as directed by management.

 **UNIFORM**

* Provided by Theatre: AMC-issued shirt, black pants, black belt, and nametag.
* Provided by Associate: Black shoes, socks.


AMC and its subsidiaries are committed to equal employment opportunity and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local employment laws. AMC strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination and will provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to an applicant's race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, military status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other reason prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law, regulation, or ordinance. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment.


**Minimum Job Requirements**


* Age 18 or older other location-specific age requirements may apply.


Requirements to be performed, with or without reasonable accommodation:

* Standing, walking, lifting, twisting, and bending on a frequent basis.
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds and carry it up to 90 feet (or deposit into dumpster or trash compactor)

**About AMC**


AMC amazing. That's the promise we deliver to nearly 35,000 associates, 240 million guests domestically, and 350 million guests worldwide each year. AMC has propelled industry innovation since 1920, and we continue to innovate by delivering premium sight and sound, new and improved food and beverage options, and diverse content in our state-of-the-art theatres. We focus on delivering friendly, superior service to our guests. We lead by example, have fun, and give back to the communities in which we live and work. If you feel motivated and energized by our culture, and if you can name your three favorite movies in the next 30 seconds, then AMC may be the right place for you. We offer competitive compensation, excellent benefits, and an environment that encourages teamwork, inclusion, collaboration, and results.
company_description: Do you speak in movie quotes? Have a movie moment that changed your life? If you love all things movies, you may be a perfect fit for our team.

title: Coating Machine Operator - 12-hr Night Shift
description:
**Company Description**  

ITW Covid Security (Cranbury, NJ) is a member of the ITW Specialty Films division of Illinois Tool Works (NYSE: ITW), a Fortune 200 global manufacturing company. At ITW Covid we produce secure holograms, laminates and overlay solutions that help authenticate and protect travel documents, personal IDs, and other official documents around the world.


Our employees enjoy a full benefit package which includes competitively priced medical plan options with FSA and HSA plans, dental, prescription drug, vision, 401(k) with a company match, life insurance, wellness programs, employee discounts, 12 paid holidays per year, vacation and sick time starting in year of hire, and a corporate matching gift program for charitable donations!

 **Job Description** **12-hour shift (7pm-7:15am) 2-2-3 day schedule with alternating weekends off. Starting pay $28 - $30 per hour based on experience plus additional $1.25/hour shift differential. We provide a safety-first work environment, and opportunity for pay and skill advancement through our operator level program.**

The primary responsibility of this position is to setup and operate a multi-station gravure coater to produce quality product in accordance with specifications, procedures, and output requirements. Operators perform start-up and in-process testing, conduct regular visual inspection of material, perform routine cleaning and preventative maintenance of machines and rollers, replenish mixes and solvents during operation, maintain proper production records, and perform material handling duties. Additional requirements of the position include cross training on other equipment, batch making as needed, maintaining a neat and orderly work area, and strict adherence to safety policies and procedures.

 **Qualifications**  

Our ideal candidate has a stable employment history, a positive and collaborative attitude, a desire to learn, and a demonstrated ability to work safely in producing a quality product. Candidates selected for employment must pass a post-offer drug screen and background check.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* High school diploma or equivalent preferred
* 2-5 years’ experience with industrial machine setup, operation and troubleshooting preferred. Experience with gravure coating and/or working work with inks, printing, viscosity, hazardous materials, and weighing or mixing chemicals desired but not required.
* Ability to work overtime/flexible shift as needed.
* The physical requirements include frequent walking, bending, pushing/pulling, and lifting/carrying up to 35 lbs.; occasional standing, sitting, twisting/turning, reaching, performing overhead work, ability to lift up to 50 lbs.; and continuous ability to visually identify product quality defects.

  

**Additional Information**  

ITW Specialty Films is a division of Illinois Tool Works (NYSE: ITW), a Fortune 200 global diversified industrial manufacturer. ITW Specialty Films designs, manufactures and markets specialized coated and/or metalized films for the Card, Security, and Medical markets. We offer a safe, clean work environment with a stable company.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the online application system due to your disability, please email hrdept@itwsf.com to request assistance. No other requests will be acknowledged.

*ITW is an equal opportunity employer. We value our colleagues’ unique perspectives, experiences and ideas and create workplaces where everyone can develop their careers and perform to their full potential.*

*As an equal employment opportunity employer, ITW is committed to equal employment opportunity and fair treatment for employees, beginning with the hiring process and continuing through all aspects of the employment relationship.*

*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Call Monitoring Analyst
description:
**Quality Assurance Monitoring Specialist Job Description:**

Quality Assurance Specialists play a key role in ensuring operational compliance through sustained monitoring of many law firm work flow processes. Members of the Quality Assurance team are extremely detail-oriented and are able to work both independently and collaboratively. To succeed as a Quality Assurance Specialist, one should be incredibly thorough and strives to help the company maintain the highest quality standards.

**Responsibilities:**

* Implementing quality assurance policies and procedures.
* Facilitating remediation for any findings as needed.
* Corrective Action Plans, Operational Risk Events: Assess, document and issue as needed remediation of potential market-related failures via the firm’s Corrective Action policies and procedures.
* Performing routine inspections and production tests of existing controls.
* Provide timely and professional communication to clients and office personnel.
* Evaluate Account Resolution Specialist production and quality performance through monthly testing.
* Track results and identify trends to help implement training opportunities as needed.
* Ensuring that federal, state, local, client, and firm regulations are observed.
* Documenting quality assurance activities and creating logs of record.
* Discuss and critique calls on calibrations with clients and fellow employees.

**Qualifications:**

* Organized with a strong attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills – both verbal and written
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively and with people at all levels of the organization.
* Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment that frequently changes.
* Ability to diagnose situations to determine the correct action.
* Ability to influence at all levels without direct authority.
* Flexibility in taking on additional responsibilities over time as the job expands and requires the monitoring of new and innovative processes.
* Microsoft Office Expertise
* Advanced analytical skills.
* Must be a self-starter, flexible, innovative and adaptive.
* Excellent project management and organizational skills and capability to handle multiple projects at once.

title: Recruiting and Onboarding Manager
description:
We are seeking a recruiting and onboarding specialist. This position requires a background in strategic recruiting, and talent mapping, as well as expertise in analysis and reporting, effective use of technology, and enhancing candidate experience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Recruiting and Talent Management:**

* Mentor hiring managers and recruiting staff, providing guidance on interview questions and identifying both required expertise and soft skills.
* Build successful, balanced teams and monitor their progress.
* Promote from within and manage internal referrals.
* Stay up-to-date on compensation trends.
* Contribute to strong pipeline generation and make informed candidate recommendations.
* Full-cycle recruiting

**Analysis and Reporting:**

* Identify and utilize metrics to measure fill ratios and applicant-to-hire ratios (e.g., 20:1).
* Monitor and report on DEI measures and the success of job posts.
* Track clicks vs. applications and develop content and design spreadsheets for leadership reporting.
* Ensure all recruitment practices comply with current employment laws and regulations.
* Maintain accurate records of all candidate interactions and recruitment activities.

**Job Post Activities:**

* Analyze and identify new sources for job postings.
* Manage and monitor diversity boards and other job board relationships.
* Determine where to post jobs, including community associations and unemployment offices.
* Manage billing associated with job boards.

**Technology Management:**

* Oversee the effective use of technology, including websites, landing pages, ATS, and AI tools for job descriptions and sourcing.
* Stay updated on recruiting trends and best practices.

**Candidate Experience:**

* Build and manage candidate relationships, considering candidates for multiple roles when applicable.
* Ensure a consistent and timely hiring process with two-way communication from candidates to recruiters and hiring managers.
* Organize and participate in career fairs.
* Stay informed about laws and industry standards related to recruiting, sourcing, and talent acquisition.
* Lead DEI initiatives and maintain up-to-date job descriptions.
* Enhance communication, pipeline building, and sourcing activity.

**Onboarding:**

* Facilitate onboarding processes and procedures to streamline new hire integration.
* Coordinate with hiring managers to schedule and conduct new employee orientations.
* Conduct onboarding sessions to familiarize new hires with company policies, procedures, and culture.
* Serve as the main point of contact for new employees during the onboarding process, addressing any questions or concerns.
* Collaborate with various departments to ensure a smooth transition for new hires into their respective roles.
* Utilize HRIS systems to track and monitor onboarding progress and compliance.
* Provide ongoing support to new employees to facilitate their acclimation to the organization.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

title: Generator Technician
description:
**Generator Technician**

**Position: Generator Technician**

**Location: Metro RF Services / New Jersey**

**Job Type: Full-Time**

Metro RF Services, Inc. is seeking a skilled and motivated Generator Technician to join our team and ensure the optimal performance and maintenance of our generators.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Installation and Setup**: Install, set up, and commission new generators and related equipment.
* **Maintenance and Repairs**: Perform routine maintenance, troubleshooting, and repairs on generators to ensure they operate efficiently and reliably.
* **Inspections**: Conduct regular inspections and diagnostic tests to identify and resolve potential issues before they lead to failures.
* **Emergency Response**: Respond promptly to emergency service calls and provide on-site support to address generator malfunctions or failures.
* **Documentation**: Maintain accurate records of maintenance, repairs, and inspections, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* **Customer Support**: Provide technical support and guidance to customers, addressing their questions and concerns regarding generator operation and maintenance.
* **Upgrades and Modifications**: Recommend and implement upgrades or modifications to enhance generator performance and efficiency.
* **Safety Compliance**: Adhere to all safety protocols and regulations to ensure a safe working environment for yourself and others.

**Requirements:**

* **Education**: High school diploma or equivalent; technical degree or certification in electrical or mechanical engineering is preferred.
* **Experience**: Minimum of 4 years of experience in generator maintenance and repair, with specific experience in routine maintenance and regular service of Generac and Kohler 40/50 kWh natural gas and diesel generators.
* **Certifications**: Valid certifications for Generac and Kohler generators.
* **Technical Skills**: Proficiency in diagnosing and repairing diesel and gas-powered generators, as well as familiarity with electrical systems and components.
* **Problem-Solving**: Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve generator issues efficiently.
* **Communication**: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact professionally with customers and team members.
* **Physical Requirements**: Ability to lift heavy equipment, work in confined spaces, and perform tasks that require physical exertion.
* **Licenses**: A valid driver's license and any additional relevant industry certifications are a plus.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Retirement savings plan with company match.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.
* Supportive and collaborative work environment.

**Compensation:**

$25.00 - $35.00 per hour

**Metro RF Services is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.**

title: Sales Associate
description:
**About us**

Sierra Site Safety is a small business in New York, NY. We are professional, agile, professional and our goal is to Sierra Site Safety is a premier provider of construction safety solutions dedicated to ensuring the highest standards of safety on job sites. With a comprehensive range of products and services, including safety equipment, training, and consulting, we are committed to protecting workers and enhancing operational efficiency. Our expert team leverages industry knowledge and best practices to deliver tailored safety solutions that meet the unique needs of each client. At Sierra Site Safety, we prioritize the well-being of workers and strive to create safer work environments across the construction industry..

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Food provided
* Growth opportunities

We are seeking a dynamic Sales Associate to join our team at Sierra Site Safety, a leading construction safety company. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sales and providing exceptional customer service. This position offers an opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment and grow within the construction and safety industry.

Duties

* Utilize sales techniques to promote and sell safety products and services
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients in the construction industry
* Operate CRM systems to manage customer information and sales pipeline
* Assist customers in understanding the benefits of our safety products and provide detailed product information
* Maintain a clean and organized workspace
* Handle customer inquiries and resolve any issues promptly
* Upsell products and services to increase sales revenue
* Conduct market research to identify potential clients and business opportunities
* Attend industry events and trade shows to promote our products and services

Experience

* Previous experience in sales, preferably in the construction or safety industry
* Familiarity with CRM systems and sales tracking procedures
* Strong customer service skills with the ability to engage with diverse customers
* Bilingual proficiency, especially in Spanish, is a plus
* Excellent time management skills to prioritize tasks effectively
* Knowledge of construction safety regulations and products is an advantage

Compensation

* Base Salary: $1000-$2000/Month based on experience
* Commission: Performance-based commission structure

Join our team as a Sales Associate and embark on a rewarding career in sales with Sierra Site Safety!

title: Bakery Clerk
description:
Job Overview:  
Become a vital part of our bakery team as a Bakery Clerk, where you will play a key role in delivering exceptional bakery products and customer service. As a Bakery Clerk, you will be responsible for assisting customers, maintaining bakery displays, and ensuring a seamless bakery operation.

Duties:  
- Assist customers in selecting bakery items, providing recommendations, and upselling products to enhance their experience  
- Maintain cleanliness and organization of the bakery area, including display cases and workstations  
- Uphold food safety standards by handling products properly, monitoring freshness, and following sanitation guidelines  
- Collaborate with the kitchen staff to coordinate baking schedules and restocking of products  
- Demonstrate excellent customer service skills by engaging with patrons in a friendly and helpful manner  
- Help in preparing simple bakery items such as pastries, bread, and cakes under supervision  
- Sanitize equipment and work areas regularly to ensure a hygienic environment

Requirements:  
- Prior experience in a bakery, café, or retail setting is advantageous  
- Familiarity with retail math concepts for cash handling and transactions  
- Knowledge of food safety practices to maintain product quality and freshness  
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail  
- Experience using POS systems for order processing is beneficial  
- Passion for the bakery industry and willingness to learn new skills  
- Strong communication skills and the ability to work well within a team environment

Joining our team as a Bakery Clerk offers an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic bakery operation, interact with customers, and contribute to the success of our establishment. If you are enthusiastic about baked goods, excel in customer service, and possess the desired skills for this role, we invite you to apply for this rewarding position.

description:
**WellLife Network is seeking a Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner to join our Brooklyn Assertive Community Treatment (ACT) program.**

ACT is team-based treatment model that provides multidisciplinary, flexible treatment and support to people with severe mental illness.

**WHO YOU ARE**: The Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner provides psychiatric and medical assessment and treatment; and development, maintenance, and supervision of medication and psychiatric and medical treatment.

**SOME ESSENTIAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:**

* The nurse practitioner must provide community-based services; the initial assessment visit must be in the community and monthly community visits thereafter.
* Collaborate with the treatment team in comprehensive assessment of psychiatric history, mental status, and diagnosis; physical and dental health; use of drugs or alcohol; education and employment; social development and functioning; activities of daily living and family structure and relationships.
* Collaborate with the nurses in assessment of client physical health, making appropriate referrals to community physicians for further assessment and treatment, and coordinating medical treatments with psychiatric treatment.
* Prescribe psychotropic medications and conduct regular assessments of therapeutic responses and side effects and educate clients regarding psychotropic medications.
* Along with other team members, provide support, education, and counseling to family members of clients to help them become knowledgeable about mental illness, collaborate in the treatment process and assist in their family member’s progress.
* Provide on and off-site crisis assessment and management of patients during regular work hours, both on-site and over the phone, during other hours, and as on-call backup.
* Regularly attend daily team meetings at least 3-4x per week.
* Direct and collaborate with the nurses to develop, revise, maintain and supervise team psychopharmacologic and medical treatment and medication policies and procedures.
* Maintain confidentiality at all times.

**Qualifications:**

* Currently hold a nurse practitioner certification through New York State education department and experience providing treatment with persons with severe and persistent mental illnesses.
* Clinical supervisory experience is desirable.
* A clear understanding of the characteristics and problems of adults with severe mental illnesses and be knowledgeable about the ACT model.
* Computer proficiency, including the ability to use email, navigate and enter all documentation into electronic medical record.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills and knowledge of group dynamics required
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills and knowledge of group dynamics required
* Valid New York State driver’s license and vehicle required – candidates are subject to regulatory background checks.

**WHAT WE OFFER**

* Competitive salary
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* Paid Time Off to support you with an active life outside of work
* Paid Parental Leave
* Flexible Spending Options (health care, dependent care, transit & parking)
* Employee Assistance Program to support overall mental wellbeing
* Matched 401(k) to help you invest in your future
* Generous Employee Referral Program

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. This position may be required to perform other related duties to meet the ongoing needs of the team and clients.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $148,000.00 - $165,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Psychiatry

Experience:

* Supervising experience: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)
* Certified Nurse Practitioner (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

title: Associate/Analyst â€“ Leveraged Finance Credit
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

**Job Description:**


Our Leveraged Finance Credit business represents Enterprise Credit in the leveraged finance acquisition underwriting process.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Work as part of deal teams involving leveraged finance credit, investment banking, and capital markets to underwrite non-investment grade acquisition financing transactions
* Analyzes client's financial performance by comparing it to past performance, projections, and industry standards
* Reviews financial statements
* Assists in the underwriting and credit risk analysis of new transactions or existing transactions, while adhering to all relevant policies and procedures
* Builds projection models based on historical performance, industry forecasts, and other due diligence findings
* Trains, coaches, and mentors Credit Analysts
* Evaluate, analyze and assess corporate mergers, acquisitions and leveraged buyout transactions
* Review and analyze underwriting materials, such as: financial statements, presentations, projections, Quality of Earnings, Credit Ratings and other third-party reports
* Acquire understanding of new businesses and industries in a short period of time
* Identify and define key credit risks and weigh them against relevant mitigants
* Conduct due diligence with clients
* Present analysis of risks and associated mitigants to senior leaders in credit approval committees
* Contribute to and create approval documents for the initial acquisition finance underwriting
* Other projects as assigned, such as: reports synthesizing risk exposure statistics, market data over time, and reports on recently announced transactions

**Required Qualifications:**

* 1+ year experience working in investment banking or capital markets
* Financial analysis of public, private and non-traditional financial statements, presentations and projections
* Business acumen to identify key credit risks and variables to sensitize and diligence with the client
* Financial forecasting and modeling
* Analytical thinking and attention to detail to challenge client forecasting assumptions and identify credit concerns
* Advanced decision making for underwriting and stress case modeling
* Written communication to succinctly explain and document the various assumptions made in the model by the client and EC as well as analysis of quarterly financial performance

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in finance, accounting or another related field
* 2 years’ experience or MBA for Associate level role

**Skills:**

* Analytical Thinking
* Financial Analysis
* Financial Forecasting and Modeling
* Profitability Analysis
* Research Analysis
* Attention to Detail
* Business Acumen
* Credit and Risk Assessment
* Underwriting
* Written Communications
* Collaboration
* Critical Thinking
* Portfolio Analysis
* Prioritization
* Technical Documentation

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40

title: Digital Project Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

iProspect is a global, award-winning agency – focused on converting consumer intent into action and driving business performance for some of the world’s largest brands. For brands to win, they must understand consumers' intent and harness the best digital platforms and systems to not only engage but convert them. iProspect excels in finding the sweet spot between brands and people. Information and choices. Intentions and data. It's our specialty.

 **Job Description**  

As the Digital Project Manager, you will assist the Account Team with the development and ongoing management of all programs that support the Media Service Line vertical.


You will manage multiple concurrent projects, daily program activities required to conduct business to meet assigned client’s needs and positively affect revenue, gross margin and position in the marketplace. This is a remote position reporting to Senior Director, Creative and Product Operations.


Primary Responsibilities:

* You will help develop our client programs, working with account, marketing, media, program management, creative and analytics teams
* You will establish yourself as a ‘go-to’ person for our clients and vendor partners on daily program management
* You will communicate with teams on our client goals to ensure project implementation solves for and align with team goals
* You will manage daily and weekly performance summaries to identify program refinement needs and to provide performance updates to external clients
* You will help develop client presentations including data mining, data presentations (charts, graphs, etc.), competitor research, etc.
* You will lead internal and external status meetings; capture, store and provide meeting summaries with outlined action items and required communications regarding next steps
* You will research, and report on competitive activity in the marketplace and recommend program adjustments accordingly
* You will be the point of escalation internally for all issues, bug reports, and change orders
* You will review all work before delivering to our client; coordinate internal reviews and implementation related QA efforts
* You will keep track of lessons learned and share with our teams

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field
* 2+ years of experience (online customer acquisition experience a plus)
* At least (3) years of online agency marketing experience and experience delivering projects within an interactive advertising or digital marketing agency environment
* Experience in online consumer marketplace and marketing concepts and channels (e.g. site testing, active channels – SEM, SEO)
* Collaboration with interdepartmental teams (media, creative, project management)
* Comfortable working with external software development facilities and resources
* Client engagement/management experience required
* Data and performance analysis experience
* Have understanding of basic revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections
* Proficient in all aspects of project management process groups (initiating, planning, executing, monitoring / controlling, closing)

  

**Additional Information**  

The anticipated salary range for this position is $68,000 - $110,400. Actual salary will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other factors permitted by law. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available. For more information regarding dentsu benefits, please visit dentsubenefitsplus.com


#LI-Remote

**About dentsu**  

Dentsu is an integrated growth and transformation partner to the world’s leading organizations. Founded in 1901 in Tokyo, Japan, and now present in more than 110 markets, it has a proven track record of nurturing and developing innovations, combining the talents of its global network of leadership brands to develop impactful and integrated growth solutions for clients. Dentsu delivers end-to-end experience transformation (EX) by integrating its services across Media, CXM and Creative, while its business transformation (BX) mindset pushes the boundaries of transformation and sustainable growth for brands, people and society.


Dentsu, Innovating to Impact.


Find out more:  

https://www.dentsu.com/  

https://www.group.dentsu.com/en/


We are champions for meaningful progress and we strive to be a force for good—for our people, for our clients, for the industry and for our society. We keep our people at the center, creating space for growth, understanding and learning so they can thrive. We embed diversity, in our mindset, in our solutions and in our teams to empower an inclusive, equitable and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators with each other and with our clients, driving better outcomes for all.


Dentsu (the "Company") is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee of the Company, on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done that will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing an undue hardship on the Company. Please contact your recruiter if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process or to request or discuss an accommodation in connection with a job at the Company to which you are applying.

title: Foodservice Worker K-12 School Dining
description:
Metz Culinary Management is growing and we have openings for Rock Star Culinary and Hospitality Team Members who shares our passion for Food and Service. We are seeking team members for full and part-time roles in a busy K-12 School Cafe setting. This is a great opportunity for Culinary Grads! Metz Culinary Management offers competitive wages, benefits and Daily Pay\\* option!

  

**Culinary Team Members:** Our Team Members start their Culinary Career learning the front and back of the Dining Services Industry. In a hospitality driven, multi dining outlet setting, you will perform duties to include plating, set up and tear down of cafe, restaurant, retail areas, or assist in kitchen to include prep, dish room, dry stock and perishable food inventories and sanitation. Must bring a strong work ethic, a **SMILE** and enjoy working in a **TEAM** environment.

  

**Line and Prep Cooks**: Prepare and present **DELICIOUS** meals and **IMPRESSIVE** presentations following our Executive Chef Menus. Ability to inventory and portion ingredients. Additionally, assist in kitchen to include prep, dish room, dry stock and perishable food inventories and sanitation. Experience in resort would be ideal but willing to train the right person with a passion for food.

  

**Catering Team Members**: This is a great part time opportunity to learn and grow while providing a fun atmosphere to show off your **HOSPITALITY** and attention to detail creating beautiful presentations of food and displays. Catering Team Members create, transport, setup, serve and breakdown banquet-style food displays with amazing hospitality and guest experience focus. These catering events range from small casual business lunches to amazing and extravagant black tie events.

  

**Cafeteria Substitutes**: Working on an as needed basis, we are seeking Cafeteria substitutes to jump in where needed in a busy K-12 kitchen and dining cafe setting. Substitutes will perform duties to include plating, set up and tear down of cafe, retail areas, or assist in kitchen to include prep, dish room, dry stock and perishable food inventories and sanitation. Must bring a strong work ethic, a SMILE and enjoy working in a **TEAM** environment.

 **QUALIFICATIONS**: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. This can be full or part-time and provides very flexible schedules. Hospitality experience is desired and a **SMILE** is required!

 **Requirements**:


Experience desired but we are willing to train candidates with a passion for food and understands the basics


Ability to apply elementary mathematical statistics that would apply to inventory and portioning


Be willing to roll up sleeves and contribute where needed


Hospitality-driven


Able to work and thrive in a team environment


Brings a SMILE and strong work ethic to the TEAM

  

Metz Culinary Management is a **FAMILY-DRIVEN** company that collaborates with its partners to deliver **RESTAURANT-INSPIRED** hospitality to each and every guest. \\*Daily Pay is an optional employee benefit. Learn more at Dailypay.com

title: School Psychologist (2024-2025 SY)
description:
JobID: 9201  

**Position Type:**  

 Specialized Learning/School Psychologist  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/8/2024  

**Location:**  

 NECC: Norwalk Early Childhood Center  

(High-Needs School)  

**Date Available:**  

 August/2024  

**2024-2025 SCHOOL YEAR**  

**SCHOOL PSYCHOLOGIST**  

**NORWALK EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTER**
  

**JOB SUMMARY**  

  

School Psychologists develop strategies and interventions to assist students in succeeding. They measure and interpret the intellectual, adaptive, academic, social and emotional development of children; interpreting results of psychological studies; interpreting and applying state and federal codes.  

  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**  

  

The following identifies the primary and essential functions of the position and is not intended to be an exhaustive listing of all duties.+ Administers standardized and/or supplemental assessments for the purpose of measuring the intellectual, adaptive, academic, social and emotional development of children and/or determining eligibility for services in compliance with regulatory requirements
+ Assesses students' functional capabilities and home and/or classroom environment for the purpose of determining student's functional level and developing recommendations and/or placement
+ Assists other staff for the purpose of developing and applying student monitoring systems and designing academic and behavioral interventions.
+ Assists all specialists (e.g. autism consultants, behavior specialists, occupational and physical therapist, speech language pathologists, etc.) for the purpose of creating and delivering student supports
+ Compiles information from a variety of sources (e.g. administrators, teachers, nurse, parents, mental health agencies, other professionals, etc.) for the purpose of producing a comprehensive screening/ evaluation report in compliance with established guidelines.
+ Has strong understanding in Response to Intervention for the purpose of interpreting the data to intervene, offering interventions and eventually determining eligibility
+ Counseling to assist students in developing positive social skills. Psychological testing as per PPT recommendations.
+ Utilize appropriate crisis intervention techniques.
+ Create opportunities for students to learn/practice new skills/behaviors related to IEP goals.
+ Utilize appropriate clinical skills/techniques during individual/group counseling sessions.
+ Receives administrative and technical supervision from the Director of Pupil Personnel Services and general supervision from the building principal.
+ Performs related duties as required.

  

**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS**
+ Experience working with young children
+ Public school experience with students displaying social/emotional/behavioral needs
+ Experience in behavior management (development and program implementation)
+ Collaborative working style
+ Ability to communicate ideas and directives clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing
+ Effective, active listening skills
+ Ability to work effectively with others
+ Organizational and problem solving skills


  

**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**
+ Connecticut School Psychologist certification.
+ At least 2 years public school experience working with students with autism and other behavior challenges.
+ Preferred; DBT training
+ Experience with the PPT process.
+ Experience with writing IEP goals/objectives.
+ Working collaboratively with colleagues.

  

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
+ Experience with all levels of school-aged students with behavioral challenges
+ Spanish fluency is an asset.

  

Days: Monday – Friday  

Salary: In alignment with NFT contract
**Apply at**  

**www.norwalkps.org/applynow**  

**Click “Employment”**  

  

**NORWALK IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**

title: Social-Emotional Learning Community Specialist (2024-2025 SY)
description:
JobID: 9204  

**Position Type:**  

 Elementary School Teaching  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/8/2024  

**Location:**  

 Tracey Elementary School  

**Date Available:**  

 August/2024  

**2024-2025 SCHOOL YEAR**  

**SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL LEARNING COMMUNITY SPECIALIST**  

**TRACEY MAGNET ELEMENTARY SCHOOL**
**Position Description**
========================


This will be a full-time teacher that will facilitate a Social Emotional Learning specials class, focused on teaching mindfulness and heartfulness practices on a rotating schedule, to students in Kindergarten through Fifth Grade.
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
====================


+ Follows the scope and sequence of the instructional program as defined and approved by the Norwalk Board of Education.
+ Through games, videos, and hands-on lessons, students will learn skills for learning (such as self-talk), empathy, emotion management, and problem-solving.
+ Facilitate teacher training so that they can continue the practices students are learning in their classrooms, making mindfulness a daily practice during morning meetings and throughout the day, as needed.
+ Attend grade level meetings and behavior team meetings, when applicable
+ Serve on the PBIS Committee
+ Facilitate parent and family workshops
+ Collaborate with the PE/ Health teacher for lesson planning and delivery
+ The teacher will work off of a cart and travel from classroom to classroom.
+ Manages the classroom and individual student behavior utilizing a restorative practices approach to maintain an advantageous learning environment.
+ Maintains accurate and complete records as required.
+ Designs clear and specific learning assessments that capitalize on emergent bilinguals’ abilities.
+ Maintains a positive learning environment that encourages open communication between the teacher and the learner.
+ Maintains a positive school community image that encourages ethical student behavior through the implementation of the PBIS framework.
+ Maintains ongoing communication with parents in either English or Spanish.
+ Assists in the selection of textbooks, equipment, and other educational materials.
+ Establishes and maintains professional relationships.
+ Participates in professional learning by attending seminars and workshops to improve biliteracy instructional practices and positively affect student achievement.

  

**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS**
+ Experience working with young children in mindfulness meditation.
+ Ability to communicate ideas and directives clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing, in the target language.
+ Effective, active listening skills.
+ Ability to work effectively with others in a close, collaborative environment.
+ ?Organizational and problem-solving skills.
+ Knowledge of the development of the emergent bilingual student.?
+ Experience using strategies for second language learners such as SIOP, the Bridge, and other biliteracy strategies.

  

**QUALIFICATIONS**
+ ?CSDE K-6 Elementary Cert.
+ Mindfulness training
+ School psychologist or social worker background preferred
+ Background in development psychology preferred
+ Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the Superintendent and/or Norwalk Board of Education may find appropriate

  

Days: Monday – Friday  

Salary: In alignment with NFT contract  

**Apply at**  

**www.norwalkps.org/applynow**

title: Clinical Specialist, Wound Care Supplies
description:
Asure Wound Solutions is seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Wound Care Clinical Specialist to join our team. This is a remote position based in the northern New Jersey area and requires experience working in nursing homes or long-term care facilities as well as a strong background in wound care. The ideal candidate must be comfortable driving distances up to 2 hours away.



Starting salary for this position is $80,000/yr



Shift: Monday - Friday


**Wound Care Responsibilities:**


* Provide clinical expertise and support to nursing homes and long-term care facilities in the management of wounds and wound-related conditions
* Develop and implement wound care plans for residents in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team
* Educate and train nursing home staff on proper wound care techniques, products and equipment usage
* Collaborate with healthcare professionals to ensure proper wound care is provided in a timely manner
* Monitor and document the progress of wounds and adjust wound care plans as needed
* Maintain current knowledge of best practices in wound care and stay abreast of new developments in the field


**Wound Care Requirements**:


* Active nursing license
* At least 3 years of nursing experience in nursing homes or long-term care facilities
* Wound care certification preferred
* Strong understanding of wound care principles and practices
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Strong computer skills and proficient in Microsoft Office
* Must be comfortable driving distances up to 2 hours away


Asure Wound Solutions offers a competitive salary and benefits package for our Wound Care Clinical Specialists. If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for wound care, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
company_description: aSure Wound Solutions innovates wound care for better healthcare outcomes. We offer advanced products and services to improve patient care and streamline processes for long-term care facilities.

title: Child Life Specialist - 14 hours/week
description:
**Child Life Specialist -** 14 hours/week

**THE BEST CAREERS.** RIGHT HERE

@ BROOKLYN’S LEADING HEALTHCARE SYSTEM**.**

**MAIMONIDES: TOP TEN IN THE U.S. FOR CLINICAL OUTCOMES**

We’re Maimonides Health, Brooklyn’s largest healthcare system, serving over 250,000 patients each year through the system’s 3 hospitals, 1800 physicians and healthcare professionals, more than 80 community-based practices and outpatient centers*. At Maimonides Health, our core values* ***H.E.A.R.T*** *drives everything we do. We uphold and maintain Honesty, Empathy, Accountability, Respect, and Teamwork to empower our talented team, engage our respective communities and provide patient-centered care.* The system is anchored by Maimonides Medical Center, one of the nation’s largest independent teaching hospitals and home to centers of excellence in numerous specialties; Maimonides Midwood Community Hospital (formerly New York Community Hospital), a 130-bed adult medical-surgical hospital; and Maimonides Children’s Hospital, Brooklyn’s only children’s hospital and only pediatric trauma center. Maimonides’ clinical programs rank among the best in the country for patient outcomes, including its Heart and Vascular Institute, Neurosciences Institute, Bone and Joint Center, and Cancer Center. Maimonides is an affiliate of Northwell Health and a major clinical training site for SUNY Downstate College of Medicine.

**In this Per-Diem role as a Child Life Specialist you will provide Child Life/ Creative Arts Therapy services for a 25-bed Pediatric Unit & an 11-bed Pediatric Intensive Care Unit.** . For info: https://maimonidesevents.org/children/. **Some responsibilities include:**

* Assess and communicate developmental and psychosocial concerns of infants, children, youth, and families to multi-disciplinary team.
* Provide psychoeducation specific to the population served, including preparation and support for potentially stressful medical experiences.
* Utilize appropriate non-pharmacological pain management strategies.
* Assess responses to stress; plan, implement and evaluate care accordingly.
* Introduce and facilitate rehearsal of techniques to aid immediate and long-term coping with consideration for the unique needs of the individual and family
* Precept and/or supervise students, graduate interns and volunteers.
* Evaluate, develop & implement services within culture of the work environment.
* Encourage creative expression with various creative arts modalities.

**We require:**

* Master's Degree in Child Life, Creative Arts Therapy, Therapeutic Recreation or related field strongly preferred.
* Certified Child Life Specialist or ability to gain certification within one year of employment.

OR

* License within one of the following Creative Art Therapies; Music, Art, Dance, Drama, Play Therapy
* A valid License issued by the New York State Education Department to practice in respective field.
* Ability to work flexible hours and some weekends to cover full time Child Life Specialist

**Salary 38.42 - 51.93 based on experience.** For immediate consideration, email resume, cover letter and references to: AEllis@maimo.org

Maimonides Medical Center (MMC) is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard for race, creed (religion), color, sex, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, predisposing genetic characteristic, marital status or domestic violence victim status, citizenship status, or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. MMC is committed to following the requirements of the New York State Human Rights Law with regard to non-discrimination on the basis of prior criminal conviction and prior arrest.

title: Associate Veterinarian - St. Georges Veterinary Hospital - Avenel, New Jersey
description:
Join Our Team at St. Georges Veterinary Hospital! 
Are you a passionate, dedicated DVM looking to make a difference in the lives of pets and their families? Look no further! St. Georges Veterinary Hospital, nestled in the heart of Avenel, NJ, is seeking a Part-Time or Full-Time associate to join our dynamic team.
Why Choose St. Georges?
 Established Excellence: With over 30 years of service to our community, we've become a trusted name in veterinary care, boasting a loyal clientele base.* ️ Supportive Environment: Our experienced support staff ensures seamless operations, allowing you to focus on what you do best—providing top-notch care to our furry patients.


 ️ Cutting-Edge Facility: Step into our newly remodeled clinic equipped with state-of-the-art technology, including therapeutic laser, in-house lab, ultrasound, digital radiology, dental radiology, and more.
 Comprehensive Benefits Package: We believe in taking care of our team. Enjoy competitive salary, student loan assistance, mentorship programs, 401K with match, work-life balance initiatives, health plan with vision and dental coverage, and generous CE allowance.
 ️ Ideal Location: Located in the family-friendly suburb of Woodbridge Township, Avenel offers access to a plethora of attractions, from scenic parks to cultural centers. Plus, with Newark and NYC just a stone's throw away, and Philly within an hour's drive, adventure awaits at your doorstep.
Join Our Team Today!
If you're ready to make a difference in the lives of pets and their families while enjoying a supportive work environment and vibrant community, apply today! You can reach out to me directly at christina.slay@amerivet.com
We can't wait to welcome you aboard!
At AmeriVet, your well-being, your loved ones, and your future are our top priorities. This commitment is reflected in the comprehensive range of benefits we offer, including:* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) matching
* Generous holidays and paid time off
* Career development programs
* Robust health and wellness initiatives
* Employee referral bonus programs and much more!
  

AmeriVet takes pride in embracing the uniqueness and diversity that every team member, pet owner, and pet brings to our community. Our unwavering dedication revolves around nurturing a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion, where each team member not only feels a strong sense of belonging, but is also empowered to thrive.
company_description: Amerivet is a place where people and pets come first, where your skills & hard work will be appreciated and rewarded. Find your next DVM role today at one of our 200+ locations across the country.

title: Liquor Store Cashier
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and friendly Cashier to join our retail team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for handling customer transactions, maintaining store appearance, and ensuring a positive shopping experience. The Cashier will work in a fast-paced environment, utilizing their sales and communication skills to drive sales and customer satisfaction. This role can lead to a larger role in the store as a manager with high sale incentives & compensations.

Responsibilities:

- Educating customers on our wines & spirits

- Helping customers choose a bottle that best suits their preferences

- Ability to recommend alternatives to brands we may not carry

- Greet customers in a warm and welcoming manner, answering any questions they may have and offering assistance as needed.  
- Operate a cash register or point-of-sale system, accurately processing transactions and handling cash, credit, and debit transactions.  
- Maintain a clean and organized store environment, including the checkout area, ensuring that all areas are tidy and free of clutter.  
- Provide exceptional customer service, responding to customer inquiries and resolving any issues in a professional and courteous manner.  
- Upsell and promote products to increase sales and meet sales goals.

Experience:

- Previous experience in a liquor store or liquor sales industry is required.  
- Experience handling cash and operating a point-of-sale system is essential.  
- A strong background in sales and customer service is desired.

Skills:

- extensive knowledge of wine & spirits

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.  
- Strong sales and customer service skills.  
- Proficiency in cash handling and operating a point-of-sale system.  
- Ability to upsell and promote products to increase sales.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 20 per week

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

Ability to Commute:

* Babylon, NY 11702 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Construction / Ground Maintenance at Private Airport, Wall Twp.
description:
Join our Team!~

**Monmouth Executive Airport** is seeking a full-time building and ground facility worker to join our on-site maintenance team.

**Position Summary:** The ideal candidate for the Grounds Facilities Worker position will have general knowledge in construction and is responsible for performing a variety of daily tasks including the maintenance and repair of buildings and landscape grounds. Essential functions and responsibilities of the position may vary based on client requirements and business needs.

**Essential Functions:**

· Inspects assigned areas on a routine basis and performs maintenance where necessary to keep facility in functioning and serviceable condition.

· Learn to operate mowing and snow removal equipment

· Repairs various fixtures and hardware such as doors, windows, etc.

· Knowledge of framing, installing windows and doors, siding, insulation installation, drywall install and finish, trim work and painting preferred

· Reports any major maintenance needs and recommends corrective action as appropriate

· Other duties and task as assigned by manager

**Qualifications:**

· Previous maintenance experience required

* Must be able to follow basic safety procedures and precautions due to physical risks
* Demonstrates interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
* Requires frequent lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling of up to 50 lbs.
* Requires occasional stooping, kneeling, crouching, and crawling
* Plumbing, Electrical and HVAC general knowledge, or the ability to learn, preferred
* Valid driver’s license and vision correctable to 20/20 is required

.A full benefits package is available with this position.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $19.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Evening Counselor
description:
The Counseling Center:  

Position Title: Counselor  

  

Come join a rapidly expanding, leading national substance abuse & mental health organization who is currently seeking a Counselor for their growing Mental Health Intensive Outpatient Counseling program! We have achieved this remarkable growth by building a reputation for compassionate care, clinical expertise, continuous improvement and a focus on exceeding the expectations of our patients, clients, and their families. At our company, you can enjoy a rewarding career.  

  

Counselor Duties/Responsibilities:  

* New patient intake and orientation
* Conducts initial assessment of patient problems and needs and reports to clinical team to initiate treatment planning
* Conducts individual sessions
* Facilitates groups with patients
* Addresses patient's concerns and helps eliminate possibility of AMA
* Provides Case Management
* Provides tours for prospective patients and their families as requested.
* Documentation in patient medical record

  

Counselor Requirements:  

* Must have one of the following: LAC, LPC, LSW or LCSW
* Mental Health license or certification, clean and active
* New graduates welcome
* Experience conducting group sessions
* Flexibility and willingness are great attributes

  

Counselor Schedule:  

* Full Time
* 1PM - 9:30PM

  

Counselor Compensation:  

Hourly rate competitive with experience and location  

  

Full time employees may be eligible for the following:  

* Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision, and STD options
* Medical FSA and Dependent Care Account
* 401k with company match up to 5%
* Accrued PTO Plan
* Education reimbursement
* Career Advancement Opportunities

  

\\*\\*\\* This job does NOT sponsor visa's and we are unable to consider out of country applicants \\*\\*\\*  

  

If you are interested in this opportunity or know someone that you respect who would be a good fit for this position, please email:  

Clay- Clay@praesumhealthcare.com Healthcare Recruiter  

  

#IND911
company_description: The Counseling Center currently operates 11 Intensive Outpatient counseling facilities in New Jersey, New York and Massachusetts with more locations coming!

title: EMG
description:
## Overview We are seeking an EMG professional to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in healthcare and possess a diverse skill set to contribute effectively to our medical practice. ## Duties - Perform Electromyography (EMG) procedures on patients - Utilize ICU experience to ensure accurate and efficient testing - Conduct catheterization procedures as needed - Apply anatomy knowledge to interpret test results - Provide health coaching to patients based on EMG findings - Collaborate with physicians on patient care plans - Assist with esthetic laser treatments if required - Participate in clinical research projects related to EMG - Offer orthopedic support and guidance to patients ## Qualifications - Proficiency in EMG systems and equipment operation - Strong knowledge of pathology related to EMG testing - Experience in addiction counseling is a plus - Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team environment

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Language:

* bilingually in English and Chinese (Preferred)

* BC/BE (Preferred)

title: Retail Sales Seasonal Associate
description:
As a **Seasonal Sales Associate** (i.e. Cashier), you will be collaborative and inclusive in helping our customers while being part of a fun, team-oriented retail culture. You’ll provide exceptional customer service and have our customer’s needs in mind while helping them find products and providing solutions.


**Get great perks.**

* Flexible part time hours, weekly pay and hiring immediately
* Compensation based on qualifications and experience
* Associate store discount

**Schedule an interview immediately.**

* Schedule an interview potentially within minutes of applying. We'll let you know if you're not eligible. In-person interviews are at the store location

**Play an active role in helping both your store and your customer win.**

* Multitask on cashier, merchandising and sales responsibilities
* Respond quickly and resourcefully to customer requests and concerns
* Create a positive, inviting environment for customers
* Understand and use basic selling skills to engage and present solutions
* Be flexible on responsibilities (e.g., returns, online pick-ups, cleaning, other duties as assigned)

**Essential skills and experience:**

* Able to work a flexible schedule (including nights and/or weekends)
* Must be able to engage and speak to customers and understand their needs
* Collaborate and work with other team members
* Ability to lift/move materials in the 10-50 pound range, climb ladders, stand and walk continuously
* Basic computer skills
* Staples does not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position
