title: Administrative Assistant - Office of the President
description:
IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:* Upload Resume or Curriculum Vitae for automatic population of information to the application.
* The contact information, work experience, and education listed on your Resume/CV will be parsed and input into your Montclair application.
* Review information and double-check all fields containing information that the system parsed – the software is intelligent, but you need to verify that the data is accurate.
* In the “My Experience” section, you will find a Resume/CV upload option where you can submit your cover letter and all other supporting documents.


Note: If you have an expansive CV, we recommend that you apply manually and only include the positions you have held in the last ten (10) years. You will then be able to attach your Resume/CV, as well as all other supporting documentation in the "My Experience" section of your application.
Job Description
SUMMARY:
Reporting to the Executive Assistant to the President, the Administrative Assistant is responsible for performing clerical and administrative tasks within an office setting to support daily operations. The duties include answering and transferring phone calls to employees, greeting visitors when they arrive for meetings with staff and management, providing administrative support in the office and functioning as a fully engaged member of the staff team in a high-pressure, demanding, and very public environment.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reception* Manage front desk reception and serve as the first point of contact for all internal and external visitors; greet all visitors with interest and enthusiasm and identify the purpose of their visit.
* Answer and refer all front desk phone calls to the appropriate department, including taking messages when needed, retrieving voicemails and distributing the messages accordingly.
* Provide high level customer service to the campus community in a timely manner and manage the flow of customers in a courteous and professional manner. May be required to present policies and regulations to visitors.
* Manage Office of the President email; review email messages and respond in timely manner; forward email messages to the appropriate office staff or appropriate department for their response.
* Handle all incoming mail, including opening, time stamping and routing as required.


General Office Support* Maintain confidential filing system of electronic and paper records; databases and tracking documents such as Contact Management, internal and external directories, office inquiries and requests, and other related records.
* Coordinate room reservations and reserved parking requests.
* Maintain office supplies and purchase as needed.
* Serve as primary tech support and liaison with OIT for office technology needs (phones, copier, printer, laptop, etc.).
* Serve as back-up and assist with expense reimbursements and vendor payments through Workday Finance.


Support to Executive Assistant* Assist in daily document preparation and filing.
* Prepare and print letters and other materials as directed.
* Assist in coordination of student-related events.


Other* Assist Director of Government Relations with scheduling, document preparation and provide administrative support as needed.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Management retains the right to add or change job duties at any time.


QUALIFICATIONS:
REQUIRED:* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.
* Three or more years of experience in an administrative support role or other comparable experience.
* Excellent communication skills, including a poised and professional manner in greeting, speaking with, and providing assistance to a wide range of people, both over the phone and in person.
* Excellent computer skills including proficiency with Excel, Word, etc.
* A high degree of comfort with multi-tasking, adapting to sudden changes in office priorities or unanticipated new projects and deadlines.
* The highest level of integrity and discretion, and the ability to work with highly confidential materials in a highly confidential environment.
* Strong work ethic and willingness to learn.


PREFERRED:* Confidence in prioritizing work and working with minimal supervision.
* Excellent writing and proofing-reading skills.
* Knowledge of, or the ability to adapt to, a university and a public sector environment.
* A very high degree of organizational skills, accuracy, and attention to detail.
* A high degree of comfort working in a team environment, where each member of the team is ready to step in and help when needed.


PROCEDURE FOR CANDIDACY:
Applicants should include a resume and cover letter describing how their background, skills and education match the needs of the University. When applying, please take a moment to carefully read and follow the steps in the application instructions.
Department
President's Office Administration
Position Type
Administrative
Contact Information:
For questions or concerns, please contact Human Resources' Workday Recruiting Support at 973-655-5000 (Option 2), or email talent@montclair.edu.

title: Operations Manager - Restoration
description:
**About Us:**

We specialize in tackling the aftermath of disasters head-on, from floods and fires to storms and everything in between. With precision, compassion, and a relentless drive to restore normalcy, we're committed to being the guiding light in times of darkness.

**Our Commitment To You:**

**Generous PTO:** Your well-being matters. Enjoy ample paid time off to recharge and pursue your passions beyond the chaos.

**Competitive Pay:** Your hard work deserves recognition. We offer a compensation package that reflects your skills, experience, and dedication.

**Unlimited Potential for Growth:** Ready to take your career to new heights? Join us and unlock endless opportunities for personal and professional development.

**Positive Work Environment:** Join a team where every voice is valued, and every idea is welcomed. We foster inclusivity and support your success every step of the way.

**Strong Leadership:** Our leadership team comprises industry experts and visionaries who are dedicated to guiding and empowering you to reach your full potential.

**No Day Will Be the Same:** If you thrive on variety and love tackling new challenges, you'll feel right at home with us. Expect the unexpected, and embrace the excitement of every day.

**We Hear You! Your Ideas Matter:** Your insights can shape the future of our companies. Join us, and let your creativity and innovation shine.

**Responsibilities**

- Develop and implement strategic plans to optimize operational efficiency

- Lead and manage a team of department heads to achieve company goals

description:
**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*Must be fluent in Spanish & English\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***

**Position Summary**

Remote Focus provides care coordination services to Medicare members with chronic medical conditions. We’re currently seeking a dynamic **Enrollment** **Specialist** to engage and enroll eligible individuals in Health Home Care Coordination services & Remote Monitoring services. The enrollment specialist would also assist with member retention needs by working closely with the team to **identify, screen, engage, and enroll** members eligible for services.

The **Enrollment specialist** plays a vital role in enrolling & onboarding of patients with chronic health conditions for case management and remote patient monitoring services.

**Essential duties and responsibilities include:**

* Receive information regarding new patients from numerous referral sources, interact with the point of contact at the referral source and begin outreach efforts to the patient
* Create a new chart in the electronic medical record with all necessary medical documentation and ensure that the information in the system is current and accurate.
* Review the patient’s medical documentation and Medicare-insurance status to ensure eligibility and appropriateness of all potential enrollments.
* Perform active and meaningful outreach efforts by contacting the patient, family members and/or caregivers and explaining the goal of the program and services
* Obtain consent to the program from the patient and ensure the consent is appropriately documented and a copy of the enrollment note is uploaded into the electronic medical record
* Schedule an initial comprehensive enrollment assessment for the patient with the medical provider
* Assist with setting up the patient with the electronic medical devices for remote patient monitoring
* Perform a warm handoff with the Case Manager when the patient is officially onboarded
* Perform other related duties as assigned

**SKILLS AND/OR EXPERIENCE REQUIRED**

* One year of related *medical sales* experience required, preferably for medical or behavioral health practices
* Effective interpersonal, communication, and teamwork skills required
* Bilingual in English/Spanish

title: Supervisor, Customer Operations-Replevin
description:

The Supervisor will join the Credit and Field Operations department within Customer Operations. This position is responsible for the Replevin group section and undertakes a variety of activities which includes supervising staff and coordinating all applicable activities associated with obtaining an Order of Seizure and supporting other customer service related functions.**Responsibilities**

* Process Marshal invoices.
* Monitor and evaluate reports daily and take required actions to ensure compliance with Customer Operations' goals and standards, including the development and monitor of reports associated with Order of Seizure to accomplish its goals.
* Working with vendor and resolving system issues.

title: Technical Supervisor, Substation Ops Brooklyn PST
description:
**Overview**


This position is a recognized authority in the Company in a major area of technical specialization and responsibility. The incumbent reviews, analyzes and approves test results for routine and trouble work as well as for commissioning new or repaired relay protection equipment and systems. Provides technical consultation to various operating and maintenance organizations which is essential to the integrity and reliability of the entire electric system. Directs technicians so that required tests are made safely, efficiently and correctly. The successful candidate must be able to troubleshoot and direct repairs of unfamiliar complex circuits and equipment using various resources, schematics, wiring diagrams and manuals. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills and strong presentation skills. Must possess the ability and desire to learn and become a subject matter expert for the operation, maintenance and testing of protective relay systems, transmission and distribution equipment and Substation equipment.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** Plans, schedules, coordinates and analyzes required compliance testing including relay calibrations, trip tests, etc.
* Performs technical and feasibility design reviews and re engineering construction packages prior to and during implementation to satisfy field conditions.
* Reviews, analyzes and provides conclusion and comments for engineering to approve test results in order to commission new or repaired equipment or systems.
* Provides technical consultation to Engineering, operations and maintenance and other field groups with a high degree of reliance placed on the incumbents knowledge and experience.
* Recommends, develops and implements new designs and techniques to enhance reliability, productivity and reduce costs.
* Appraises technological developments and investigates the feasibility of employing new equipment and techniques.
* Leads troubleshooting efforts and coordinates repair and restoration of equipment and other unfamiliar complex circuits so as to minimize outages and control costs.
* Perform other related tasks and assignments as required.
* Performs all administrative functions necessary to ensure proper operation of the local workout and office facilities including time cards, material ordering, payroll, office operation, etc.
* Supervises and directs the work force, prioritizes the daily work assignments and follows up to ensure work is completed safely, economically and in compliance with specifications and procedures.
* Responds to calls 24 hours/7 days for scheduled emergency work as required.
* Plans and coordinates the efficient and timely implementation of new construction projects.
* Submits outage requests and coordinates and negotiates approvals with System Operations, Substation Operations and Electric Operations.
* Coordinates all required training to ensure compliance to safety, environmental and operating procedural requirements.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education/Experience*** Associate's Degree in Electrical Technology, Electrical Engineering Technology, Electromechanical Engineering Technology, Electronics Technology or Telecommunications Technology and a minimum of five years of experience working with protective relays and systems or related experience or three years of related experience to include two years working exclusively with substation operations protective systems and testing is required. or
* Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Telecommunications Engineering is preferred. and a minimum of three years of experience


**Preferred Education/Experience*** Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Telecommunications Engineering is preferred. and a minimum of three years of experience


**Relevant Work Experience*** A minimum of five years of experience working with protective relays and systems or related experience or three years of related experience to include two years working exclusively with substation operations protective systems and testing is required. Required
* A minimum of three years of supervisory experience or related experience is required. Required
* Must have a clear sense of accountability and be able to handle multiple tasks with changing priorities. Required
* Must possess excellent computer skills to include working with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Protest, Metaphase, AutoCAD and OSS. Required
* Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Required
* Ability to become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for protective relay systems, operation and maintenance of protective relay systems, operation of transmission and distribution equipment, electrical testing of protective relays and supervisory and control systems and communication lines and systems. Required
* Must work as a team player to ensure the success of collective goals. Required
* Knowledge of substation equipment and relay protection systems is strongly desired. Preferred


**Skills And Abilities*** Demonstrated problem solving skills
* Demonstrated analytical skills
* Effective interpersonal skills
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Well organized, detail oriented and flexible to handle multiple assignments
* Possesses strong technical aptitude
* Quickly troubleshoots and resolves problems


**Licenses And Certfications*** Driver's License Required


**Physical Demands*** Ability to respond to system emergencies
* Perform extended driving through heavy traffic and severe off-road conditions
* Ability to work in adverse conditions that include, noise, confined spaces, and high elevations
* Ability to climb ladders and stairs
* Ability to work on elevated platforms, scaffolds, catwalks, roofs, and/or other equipment
* Ability to work in inclement weather and adverse conditions (i.e., excessive heat, cold, noise, confined spaces)
* Ability to work with, and in, the vicinity of high voltage and/or other high-energy systems
* Ability to travel to company locations to work on storm restoration and heat contingencies
* Use personal vehicle(s), and be able to transport, store, and secure company laptops and other job-related equipment in vehicle. Acknowledge that reimbursement for use of personal vehicle is available through the company mileage procedure

title: Product Owner CDG Platform
description:
**Overview**


The CDG Product Owner is a key position within the Customer Operations' Strategic Applications Operation Applications and Support department, tasked with enhancing the \\*\\*end-to-end customer experience\\*\\* by harnessing insights from customer data and research to innovate on the Community Distributed Generation (CDG) Salesforce Platform. This role is crucial in refining processes, fostering new efficiencies, and offering steadfast support to our CDG customers throughout their lifecycle.As the CDG Product Owner, you will lead project and feature development, ensuring that cross-functional agile teams are in harmony with the project's strategic vision and priorities. Additionally, you will oversee the project's budget, scope, and roadmap, and champion enhancements to address the changing needs of customers. This role requires a strategic thinker with a dedication to promoting excellence in customer support and operational efficiency.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** The Product Owner will work with the department manager and stakeholders to define and prioritize winning strategies for the Community Distributed Generation (CDG) Salesforce Platform.
* The Product Owner will be responsible for the creation and support of cross-functional agile teams and will lead the end-to-end execution and management of specific CDG Salesforce Platform.
* The Product Owner will be responsible for project and features development and communications including the projects roadmap, backlog prioritization, project plans, resource utilization schedules and budget materials.
* Initiate and implement program improvements across governance and intake processes in coordination with Section Manager.
* Plan, execute, monitor, track, manage risks and issues and report on projects using traditional and Agile development processes and techniques.
* Conceive and prepare documents including design flows, customer journey maps and wireframes.
* Work with various internal organizations, stakeholders, and external vendors to collect requirements, identify enhancements needed, uncover, and fix defects and bring a project from concept to release.
* Review and approve technical requirements from Implementation contractors, making sure they align with system capabilities.
* Collaborate with various teams and external partners to enhance the CDG platform's responsiveness to customer communications.
* Develop deep understanding of all internal systems the CDG Platform touches and their interrelations to support projects integrations needs.
* Plan and manage testing associated with changes to business processes and systems, including supervising development of detailed test plans and test cases, execution of testing, documentation of findings, and working with business and technical staff to resolve identified issues and seek approvals.
* Serve as a tester on the team, creating Functional and UAT test scripts.
* Identify training needs, create, and deliver targeted employee training for optimal platform support.
* Manage all aspects of the relationship with vendors and service providers, from preparing and executing RFPs to supporting contract negotiations and tracking deliverables.
* Identify and monitor key performance metrics that validate project success and result in achieving the section and department goals.
* Ensure the CDG platform adheres to regulatory standards by consistently monitoring and updating compliance requirements to meet the expectations of regulators and stakeholders.
* Support the section on its budget forecasts, budget tracking, and financial planning efforts.
* Perform other related tasks and assignments as required.
* Use advanced critical thinking skills to diagnose complex problems.
* Support a customer-centric and service-oriented culture, taking special interest in meeting the needs of our customers, employees, and other stakeholders.

**Preferred Education/Experience*** Master's Degree and two (2) years of full-time work experience.

* Strong communications, presentation, writing, and analytical skills, required.
* Experience with creating requirements and tracking projects in Azure Dev or similar project management tools, required.
* Ability to conceptualize and write content targeting both customers and internal stakeholders, required.
* Experience leading customer-facing applications and projects, required.
* Experience managing budgets and forecasts, preferred.
* Experience in producing formal presentations and documentation for executive and regulatory share out, preferred.
* Working knowledge of an Salesforce Software, preferred.
* Experience with Agile program management and/or transformation, preferred.
* Experience with customer experience improvement projects, preferred.
* Experience with tech projects development, systems integrations, preferred.
* Familiarity with the utility sector, regulatory compliance, NY State climate goals, preferred.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
**Join Us Today!**

Unlock Your Sales Potential at AAA Club Alliance! Are you passionate about delivering exceptional service while driving sales success? Join our team and be part of a dynamic retail environment where every interaction counts. Don't wait any longer—apply now and take the next step towards a rewarding career!


**Work-Life Balance:**

* **No Sundays** : Enjoy a consistent schedule with no work on Sundays.
* **Convenient Hours:** With store hours from Monday to Friday, 8AM to 6PM, and Saturday, 8AM to 3PM; **37.5 Hour Work Week**
* **Paid Holidays** : Celebrate eight paid holidays throughout the year.
* **Generous Paid Time Off** : Accrue over three weeks of paid time off during your first year.
* **Paid Volunteer Time Off** : Make a difference in your community with paid time off to volunteer.

**Rewards and Benefits:**

* **Competitive Compensation** : A competitive hourly rate, based on experience and location.
* **Monthly Incentive Plan** : Drive your success with a monthly incentive plan tailored to reward your individual performance.
* **AAA Premier Membership** : Enjoy complimentary AAA Premier level membership benefits.
* **Medical, Dental, Vision, and Prescription Coverage** : Take care of your health with our comprehensive benefits package.
* **Tuition Reimbursement** : Invest in your future with our tuition reimbursement program.
* **401(K) Plan** : Save for your retirement with our company-matched 401(K) plan, up to 7%.

**What You'll Do:**

As a Retail Sales Associate, you'll play a vital role in delivering exceptional service to our members while promoting AAA products and services. Your responsibilities will include:


* **Sales Excellence:** Consistently up-sell and cross-sell AAA products such as new memberships, credit cards, and insurance referrals.
* **Travel Planning:** Assist members in planning domestic travel vacations, including car rentals, hotels, vacation packages, maps, tour books, and triptiks.
* **Customer Service:** Answer incoming overflow calls for Roadside Assistance during peak call volumes, ensuring timely and efficient service delivery.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* **Sales Savvy:** Bring a minimum of six (6)months of sales and customer service experience to the table, demonstrating your ability to drive results and exceed expectations.
* **Communication Skills:** Showcase effective written and oral communication skills, essential for engaging customers and articulating the value of AAA memberships.

title: Choir Teaching Artist
description:
Brooklyn Music Schools “Arts Reaching Youth” afterschool program provides a variety of accessible Arts programming for kids in the Ft. Greene neighborhood. We are looking for an enthusiastic, passionate choir teacher to teach on Mondays and Thursdays beginning September 8th, 2024. On Mondays there will be two 45 minute choir classes back to back, and on Thursday a singular 45 minute class. All classes will be expected to perform in the performance at the end of the semester.

The Brooklyn Music School’s Teaching Artists are responsible for delivering quality arts education to BMS students in the forms and formats designated by BMS Administration. Teaching Artists require strong skills in arts education, performance ability, professional communication, and knowledge of pedagogy techniques and classroom management. Teaching Artists are expected to tailor lessons and classes to a level appropriate to fulfill the needs of each student.

Responsibilities:

● Design and implement an engaging curriculum, tailored to the interests and skill levels of campers aged 5 to 11.

● Lead and supervise musical activities, including playing, singing, and

composition. Provide guidance and support to students as they explore their musical

talents.

● Accompany students during rehearsals and performances, offering instruction in music

theory, sight-reading, and ensemble singing.

● Performance Preparation: Assist with the planning and execution of recitals and sound

checks, guiding students in rehearsal techniques and stage presence.

Requirements:

● High level of proficiency in piano/sight-reading skills, with expertise in accompanying

and coaching vocalists.

● Enthusiasm for music education and a commitment to fostering a nurturing and inclusive

learning environment.

**Dates and Compensation**

Class dates: September 8th, 2024 - January 28th, 2025. Oppurtunity to continue into Spring & Summer Semester

Mondays: 4:40 - 6:15 PM

Thursdays: 4:40 - 5:25 PM

Pay is $60 an hour

title: Administrative Lab Manager
description:
*The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to departmental budgets, qualifications, experience, education, licenses, specialty, and training. The above hiring range represents the University's good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting.*

Position Summary

Columbia University's Mortimer B. Zuckerman Mind Brain Behavior Institute brings together world-class scientists across academic disciplines conducting pioneering research to transform our understanding of how the brain works – and gives rise to mind and behavior. The Institute fosters a collaborative and inclusive environment across 50+ labs, advancing insights into human health by exploring how the brain develops, performs, endures and recovers.

At the Zuckerman Institute, we are committed to becoming a more inclusive, equitable and diverse place of scientific discovery and support a culture of respect. Promoting diversity in science will help drive the transformative science that can change the world.

Situated in the Jerome L. Greene Science Center on Columbia’s Manhattanville campus, the state-of-the-art building offers an environment where the highest level of scholarly scientific research takes place on a daily basis, with the benefit of being located in the heart of New York, one of the world’s most vibrant and culturally rich cities.

The Mortimer B. Zuckerman Mind Brain Behavior Institute at Columbia University is seeking a flexible and highly motivated individual to serve as an Administrative Lab Manager. Responsibilities include administrative and research support for faculty and lab members, as well as managing relationships with the Department of Neuroscience, Department of Psychiatry, and other affiliated organizations.

***This is a part-time 25 hours per week in-person position.***

Responsibilities

* Schedules regular and special meetings; oversees group communications. Serves as point of contact for all visitors and vendors.
* Organizes and manages print and digital records, correspondence, and other files as necessary.
* Participates in development and administration of annual and grant budgets; processes and monitors expenditures, reconciles budget reports, and forecasts project budget discrepancies.
* Oversees all purchasing and service contracts for the lab as well as compliance with any contractual obligations and manages/tracks reimbursements.
* Supports and monitors research related activities to ensure compliance with the University and funding agency regulations. Maintains accurate and complete records to meet fiduciary responsibility and comply with audit requirements.
* Keeps track of non-competing submission dates for the investigators.
* Works with the grants management office of the Zuckerman Institute to ensure timely submission of all required documents for pre-award submissions.
* Reviews and approves timesheets and absences in Time Labor Absences Management (TLAM) for all lab staff.
* Partners with the Human Resources team to hire and train new personnel in compliance and proper laboratory protocols; assists the Human Resources team with renewals and termination of employment for lab personnel.
* Prepares IACUC/IRB Protocols for submission to the appropriate office, tracks IACUC/IRB expiration and revision dates.
* Serves as the administrative contact for AALAC inspections and EHS to ensure research compliance.
* Assists the Director of the Levy Research Fellows Program in coordinating administrative duties of the Levy Research Fellowship.
* Coordinates with the Department of Psychiatry to facilitate the application and selection process, monitor fellow expenditures and perform other fellowship duties as assigned.
* Assists with budget creation and monitoring for Levy Fellowship Program.
* Performs other related duties, and special assignments as required.

Minimum Qualifications

* 2–4 years of related experience. Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent related experience required.

Preferred Qualifications

* Must be highly proficient with computer applications. Experience working with Word, Excel, and other database applications is essential. Strong analytical skills needed.
* Must be organized and detail oriented and possess financial management and budget experience.
* Must have the ability to multi-task, maintain attention to detail in a busy work environment, and work independently under minimal supervision.
* Must be able to exercise judgment, initiative, and a high level of discretion. Must possess a strong ability to interact with tact and diplomacy.
* Must be able to work independently as well as collaboratively, and take a proactive approach and anticipate needs.
* Prior experience working with budgets, federal grants, and/or in grants management is highly desirable. Previous experience with RASCAL, ARC, and ASSIST is preferred.

Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

Columbia University is committed to the hiring of qualified local residents.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $54,000.00 - $58,000.00 per year

* 401(k) matching

* Flexible spending account

Schedule:

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

title: SALES REP-OFF PREMISE | NJU037
description:
**Gallo Privacy Policy**

**Why Gallo?**


With a global portfolio of over 100 unique wine and spirits brands, we are the largest family-owned winery in the world. Apply Today! **Our Brands. Your Future.**

**Summary**


By incorporating the attributes of self-confidence, enthusiasm, product knowledge, creativity, and common sense, represents all distributor products to Retail establishments.

 **What You Will Do:**

* Conducts distributor business in an assigned territory containing in such a way that an appropriate sales volume will be achieved.
* Conducts tastings at customer locations.
* Through the use of business builders and trackers, pre-plans each call for maximum effectiveness.
* Gains knowledge of competitive sales trends and pricing in order to maintain specific pricing structures on all Gallo products.
* Knows the sales trends in each account, understands the business strategies and practices of each decision maker.
* Knowledge of products, promotional and merchandising programs to achieve and maintain 100% distribution achievement in every account.
* Demonstrates entrepreneurial spirit.
* Listens carefully to needs and preferences of retail decision makers.
* Uses data facts and figures, IRI, etc. to correctly make persuasive sales presentations.
* Overcomes objections raised during a sales presentation.
* Provides guidance to Merchandisers assigned to merchandise specific store shelves, cold box, and floor displays approved by store management.
* Merchandises products through use of Point of Sale materials, cold box and shelf management, and creative mass display to stimulate impulse sales.
* Provides continuing and conscientious service to each account by managing accounts receivable, inventory, rotating display product, cold box product, and shelf stock when necessary
* Maintains up to date route cards and account records.
* Uses pocket PCs for storing and downloading customer order, and reporting sales information.
* Provides management with accurate daily sales reports and display trackings.
* Complies with all the distributor policies and procedures.
* Effectively handles special in-store problems and reporting that might occur from time to time.
* Projects a professional appearance while being resourceful, friendly and persistent with retail decision makers.
* Maintains a cooperative attitude with management and provides reports that are accurate and on time.
* Practices safe work and driving habits and, if accountable for others, ensures their understanding and compliance of such habits.
* Maintains satisfactory attendance, to include timeliness.
* Responsible for understanding and complying with applicable quality, environmental and safety regulatory considerations. If accountable for the work of others, responsible for ensuring their understanding and compliance.

 **Supervisory Responsibilities**

* N/A

 **What You Will Need:**

* Bachelor's degree; OR Senior class standing at a college or university and a Bachelor's degree is successfully completed and confirmed by the time of hire OR High school diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate plus 4 years of sales experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility; OR High school diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate plus 1 year of Gallo or affiliated or non-affiliated distributor merchandising or sales experience.
* Must be 21 years of age or older.
* Required to obtain a solicitor's permit as required by state/locality.
* Required to travel by automobile to perform job duties.
* Candidates for this position must have a valid driver’s license and safe driving record.
* Required to obtain a New Jersey driver’s license or appropriate state driver’s license within 30 days of hire.
* Required to lift and move cases of product that weighs up to 60 pounds including lifting overhead.
* Required to work weekends for special functions/events when necessary.
* Required to be 18 years or older. This may be in addition to other age requirements, if applicable, as listed in this job description.

 **What Will Set You Apart:**

* Bachelor’s degree plus 2 years retail sales experience or 2 years wine sales experience.
* Skilled in demonstrating teamwork and leadership.
* Experienced in reading and comprehending simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.
* Experienced in writing simple correspondence.
* Experienced in effectively presenting information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
* Skilled in defining problems, collecting data, establishing facts, and drawing valid conclusions. Experienced in planning and organizing work through effective project management.


Gallo does not sponsor for employment based visas for this position now or in the future.

 **Physical Demands**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Physical Demands


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to be on his/her feet for long periods of time and frequently bends, stoops and climbs. Required to lift and move cases of product that weighs up to 60 pounds, including lifting overhead.

 **Work Environment**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Work Environment


The temperature, noise level and cleanliness of the work environment vary with each retail account.

 **Compensation**:

* Hiring Salary Range Posted: $55,000 /annually in commission + incentives
* Actual compensation paid within the range will be determined by factors such as the education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

 **Perks & Benefits:**

* This position includes a competitive benefits package.

title: Head Chef
description:
**About Us:**

We are a bustling modern Italian kosher restaurant located in the heart of Long Island, where traditional flavors meet contemporary flair while adhering to kosher dietary laws. We pride ourselves on delivering an unforgettable dining experience through our innovative and exquisite menu offerings, crafted with the finest ingredients.

**Position Overview:**

We are seeking a passionate and skilled Chef with a minimum of 4 years of restaurant experience to join our dynamic culinary team. The ideal candidate will have a deep appreciation for Italian cuisine, possess strong leadership abilities, and demonstrate a commitment to culinary excellence and creativity.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Oversee daily kitchen operations, ensuring the highest standards of food quality and presentation.

- Develop and execute innovative menu items that reflect the restaurant's modern Italian vision while adhering to kosher guidelines.

- Collaborate with the culinary team to create new seasonal dishes and special event menus.

- Ensure compliance with all health and safety regulations, maintaining a clean and organized kitchen environment.

- Manage inventory, order supplies, and ensure cost-effective operations.

- Work on the line as necessary, especially during high-volume service times.

- Train, mentor, and inspire kitchen staff, fostering a positive and productive work environment.

- Monitor and control food and labor costs to achieve budgetary goals.

- Stay current with culinary trends and continuously seek opportunities for menu enhancement.

**Requirements:**

- Minimum of 4 years of restaurant experience, with a background in Italian cuisine preferred.

- Extensive knowledge of kosher dietary laws and experience in a kosher kitchen.

- Strong culinary skills with a creative approach to menu development.

- Excellent leadership and team management abilities.

- Ability to work on the line during high-volume service times.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with the culinary team.

**Business Hours:**

- Sunday-Thursday Lunch: 12:00 PM - 4:00 PM

- Sunday-Thursday Dinner: 4:45 PM - 9:45 PM

- Saturday Dinner: Seasonal Hours

Pay: $70,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

* Paid time off

* Bonus opportunities

title: Restoration General Manager
description:
**Join Our Team: Experienced Restoration General Manager Wanted!** 

Are you an experienced leader with a passion for making a difference? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments where every day presents new challenges and opportunities? If so, we want you to be the driving force behind our team as our new General Manager for our leading mitigation company!

**About Us:**

We specialize in tackling the aftermath of disasters head-on, from floods and fires to storms and everything in between. With precision, compassion, and a relentless drive to restore normalcy, we're committed to being the guiding light in times of darkness.

**Our Commitment To You:**

**Generous PTO:** Your well-being matters. Enjoy ample paid time off to recharge and pursue your passions beyond the chaos.

**Competitive Pay:** Your hard work deserves recognition. We offer a compensation package that reflects your skills, experience, and dedication.

**Unlimited Potential for Growth:** Ready to take your career to new heights? Join us and unlock endless opportunities for personal and professional development.

**Positive Work Environment:** Join a team where every voice is valued, and every idea is welcomed. We foster inclusivity and support your success every step of the way.

**Strong Leadership:** Our leadership team comprises industry experts and visionaries who are dedicated to guiding and empowering you to reach your full potential.

**No Day Will Be the Same:** If you thrive on variety and love tackling new challenges, you'll feel right at home with us. Expect the unexpected, and embrace the excitement of every day.

**We Hear You! Your Ideas Matter:** Your insights can shape the future of our companies. Join us, and let your creativity and innovation shine.

**What we are looking for in our next team member:**

We're seeking a seasoned General Manager who can lead our team to new heights of success. As the backbone of our operations, you'll be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our business, from strategic planning to day-to-day management. Your leadership will guide our team to deliver exceptional service, maintain high standards of quality, and drive growth in our competitive industry.

**Responsibilities:**

- Develop and implement strategic plans to achieve company goals and objectives

- Provide strong leadership to motivate and empower our team members

- Ensure efficient and effective operation of all business functions, including project management, finance, and customer service

- Foster a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement

- Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders

- Monitor industry trends and competitive landscape to identify opportunities for growth and improvement

- Uphold the highest standards of integrity, professionalism, and ethical conduct

**Requirements:**

- Proven experience as a General Manager or similar leadership role in the mitigation or related industry

- Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams

- Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills

- Strategic thinker with a track record of driving results and achieving targets

- Solid understanding of business principles, financial management, and operational best practices

- Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities

* Vision insurance

* Day shift
* Extended hours
* On call

* What is your motivation for success?

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
This Opportunity


WSP is currently initiating a search for a **Survey Party Chief** for our **Lawrenceville, New Jersey** office. Be involved in projects with our Survey Geospatial Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.


Your Impact


* Candidate can expect to be a leading role in the field for work on a wide variety of projects including transportation, environmental, water/wastewater, commercial, residential, solid waste, and energy - from rural areas to urban areas.
* Perform boundary & topographic surveys; engineering design surveys; GPS surveys.
* Ideal candidates will be detail oriented and organized.
* Candidates may interact with clients and the public while in the field and need to represent WSP in a positive and professional manner.
* Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.  
* 

Who You Are


**Required Qualifications**

* High School diploma is required or GED.
* 9+ years experience working in the survey profession and capable of handling topographic surveys using conventional and/or geodetic technology.
* General efficiency in Auto CAD/ MicroStation - capable of downloading and editing field data
* General awareness of land survey principles, practices, process, methods and techniques
* Experience with robotic total station is a plus.
* Valid driver license is required. Must successfully complete and pass WSP's Motor Vehicle screening.
* Proficiency with survey equipment.
* Effective interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to work independently under supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.
* Must possess a willingness to learn.
* Must be willing to work in all environments (rural, suburbs, city, etc.).
* Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.  
* 

#LI-MG1


  

  

  
**About WSP**WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper.


www.wsp.com


WSP provides a flexible and agile workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.


At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?


WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.


The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.


**NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:**

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, employment agencies, or other staffing services. Unsolicited resumes include any resume or hiring document sent to WSP in the absence of a signed Service Agreement where WSP has expressly requested recruitment/staffing services specific to the position at hand. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, will become the property of WSP and WSP will have the right to hire that candidate without reservation – no fee or other compensation will be owed or paid to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service.

title: Receptionist - PT Sundays
description:
**Receptionist**

**Part-Time: Sundays**

**Jefferson’s Ferry . . . for a Brighter Future.**

**We're growing! Jumpstart your career for an exciting future!**

*Jefferson’s Ferry is a Life Plan community and a unique concept*. It provides Independent Living and a comprehensive retirement living option for adults over the age of 62 by offering an Active Adult Community, Assisted Living, Skilled Nursing Care and Memory Care, all centrally located on one campus.

As our **Receptionist**, you will be the first point of contact for residents, vendors, and visitors in a senior living community. You will present in a professional manner at all times in this fast-paced environment, adapt to rapid changes and remain calm and focused at times of emergency alarm activations.

**In addition, you will:**

* Provide a welcoming environment and be polite and courteous while addressing any questions or needs that may arise.
* Model and promote the organization’s mission, core values, through a positive attitude, appropriate appearance, words, and actions; and comply with the organization’s policies and procedures.
* Answer, screen, manage and forward any incoming phone calls.
* Receive visitors at the front desk by greeting, welcoming, directing and announcing them properly.
* Understand and operate emergency response systems. Communicate clearly via two-way radio.
* Direct deliveries/couriers for the company.
* Operate copier, scanner, and postage equipment.

**Why work at Jefferson’s Ferry?**

* Our staff is welcoming, professional and friendly
* We offer opportunities to learn and for career growth
* You’ll work in a lively, positive environment
* We provide comfort and compassionate care in a magnificent setting
* You’ll have the support of on-site medical services for residents
* People truly enjoy working here!
* On-site café

**We require:**

* **High School Diploma**
* **Two years of experience as an Administrative Assistant and/or Receptionist**
* Proficient in Microsoft Office; Solid working knowledge of Excel
* Strong Administrative support skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent organizational & analytical skills
* Proven ability to multi-task and prioritize

**JEFFERSON’S FERRY IS THE 2023 BEST OF LONG ISLAND WINNER OF:**

* **BEST RETIREMENT COMMUNITY**
* **BEST NURSING HOME**
* **BEST ASSISTED LIVING**

**Salary: $16 - $1/hr\\***

\\*Rates are based on commensurate experience and other qualifications.

Talk to us! **Receptionist,** please forward your resume to: **jfhr@jeffersonsferry.org** or by fax 631-675-5597.

Jefferson’s Ferry – We take the best care of our employees, as well!

*An EOE m/f/d/v.*

Pay: $16.00 - $17.00 per hour

title: Film Study Instructor (Part Time)
description:
Job Summary
  
The Film Study Instructor at Concorde Education is responsible for guiding students through the exploration of film as an art form and a medium of communication. This role involves covering major topics in film studies, providing exemplars for different topics, and curating clips to illustrate key points. The instructor will develop and implement a curriculum that deepens students' understanding of film history, theory, genres, and technical aspects. The expected impact includes enhanced critical thinking, media literacy, and appreciation for the cinematic arts among students.
  
General Responsibilities
  
* Design and implement a film study curriculum tailored to the needs and interests of the students.
* Lead film study sessions that teach students about film history, theory, genres, and technical aspects.
* Foster a safe, respectful, and engaging learning environment.
* Assess students' skills and provide constructive feedback.
* Collaborate with other instructors and program coordinators to integrate the film study curriculum with other educational offerings.
* Track student progress and maintain accurate records.
* Facilitate regular communication with parents, guardians, and educational stakeholders regarding student performance and program updates.
* Ensure that all equipment and materials are properly set up, maintained, and stored.


Major Duties
  
* Curriculum Development: Develop lesson plans and learning modules that cover major topics in film studies, including history, theory, genres, and technical aspects.
* Classroom Instruction: Lead classes, ensuring that each student is actively engaged and benefiting from the educational experience.
* Student Assessment: Regularly evaluate student progress, adapting instruction to meet individual needs.
* Community Building: Create a classroom environment that encourages critical discussion, respect, and appreciation for diverse cinematic perspectives.
* Technology and Equipment Management: Ensure the optimal performance and maintenance of all audiovisual equipment and film materials.
* Documentation and Reporting: Keep accurate records of student attendance, assessment results, and feedback, submitting reports as required.


Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities
  
* Instructional Skills: Ability to design and implement a curriculum that is age-appropriate, engaging, and educational.
* Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with students, parents, and staff.
* Interpersonal Skills: Excellent teamwork and collaboration abilities. Must be open to receiving feedback and making adjustments accordingly.
* Organizational Skills: Must be able to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
* Content Knowledge: Must have extensive knowledge of film studies, including history, theory, genres, and technical aspects.

title: Table Top Game Instructor (Part Time)
description:
Job Summary
  
The Tabletop Game Instructor at Concorde Education is responsible for curating and leading engaging tabletop and card game sessions for students. This role is essential in promoting sportsmanship, understanding of rules, and strategic thinking. The instructor will develop and implement a curriculum that introduces students to a variety of age-appropriate games, fostering a fun and educational environment. The expected impact includes enhanced critical thinking, teamwork, and social skills among students.
  
General Responsibilities
  
* Design and implement a tabletop game curriculum tailored to the needs and interests of the students.
* Lead tabletop game sessions that teach students the game mechanics, strategies, and the importance of teamwork and sportsmanship.
* Foster a safe, respectful, and engaging learning environment.
* Assess students' skills and provide constructive feedback.
* Collaborate with other instructors and program coordinators to integrate the tabletop game curriculum with other educational offerings.
* Track student progress and maintain accurate records.
* Facilitate regular communication with parents, guardians, and educational stakeholders regarding student performance and program updates.
* Ensure that all equipment and game materials are properly set up, maintained, and stored.


Major Duties
  
* Curriculum Development: Develop lesson plans and learning modules that cover a wide range of tabletop and card games, emphasizing collaboration, strategy, and problem-solving.
* Classroom Instruction: Lead classes, ensuring that each student is actively engaged and benefiting from the educational experience.
* Student Assessment: Regularly evaluate student progress, adapting instruction to meet individual needs.
* Community Building: Create a classroom environment that encourages teamwork, fair play, and respect among students.
* Technology and Equipment Management: Ensure the optimal performance and maintenance of all game materials and related equipment.
* Documentation and Reporting: Keep accurate records of student attendance, assessment results, and feedback, submitting reports as required.


Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities
  
* Instructional Skills: Ability to design and implement a curriculum that is age-appropriate, engaging, and educational.
* Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with students, parents, and staff.
* Interpersonal Skills: Excellent teamwork and collaboration abilities. Must be open to receiving feedback and making adjustments accordingly.
* Organizational Skills: Must be able to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
* Content Knowledge: Must have extensive knowledge of a variety of tabletop and card games, including rules, strategies, and the principles of good sportsmanship.

title: Improv Instructor (Part Time)
description:
Job Summary
  
The Improv Instructor plays a vital role within Concorde Education by fostering creativity, spontaneity, and teamwork among students. This role involves teaching various types of improvisation, leading warm-ups, guiding students in scene creation, and imparting valuable tips and tricks to enhance their improv skills. The instructor will design and implement a curriculum that not only teaches improv techniques but also encourages students to think on their feet, collaborate effectively, and build confidence. The impact of this role is significant, as it helps students develop essential life skills such as quick thinking, problem-solving, and effective communication.
  
  

General Responsibilities
  
* Design and implement an improv curriculum tailored to the needs and interests of the students.
* Lead improv sessions that teach students the fundamentals of improvisation, including game mechanics, strategy, and teamwork.
* Foster a safe, respectful, and engaging learning environment.
* Assess students' skills and provide constructive feedback.
* Collaborate with other instructors and program coordinators to integrate the improv curriculum with other educational offerings.
* Track student progress and maintain accurate records.
* Facilitate regular communication with parents, guardians, and educational stakeholders regarding student performance and program updates.
* Ensure that all equipment and materials are properly set up, maintained, and stored.


Major Duties
  
* Curriculum Development: Develop lesson plans and learning modules that go beyond basic improv to incorporate elements of collaboration, strategy, and problem-solving.
* Classroom Instruction: Lead classes, ensuring that each student is actively engaged and benefiting from the educational experience.
* Student Assessment: Regularly evaluate student progress, adapting instruction to meet individual needs.
* Community Building: Create a classroom environment that encourages teamwork, fair play, and respect among students.
* Technology Management: Ensure the optimal performance of any required software and hardware.
* Documentation and Reporting: Keep accurate records of student attendance, assessment results, and feedback, submitting reports as required.


Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities
  
* Instructional Skills: Ability to design and implement a curriculum that is age-appropriate, engaging, and educational.
* Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with students, parents, and staff.
* Interpersonal Skills: Excellent teamwork and collaboration abilities. Must be open to receiving feedback and making adjustments accordingly.
* Organizational Skills: Must be able to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
* Content Knowledge: Must have extensive knowledge in all content areas of improvisation, including scene work, character development, and various improv games and exercises.

title: Mail Handler
description:
We are seeking a dedicated and efficient Mail Handler to join our team. The Mail Handler is responsible for the accurate and timely processing of incoming and outgoing mail and packages. This role involves sorting, distributing, and delivering mail within the organization, ensuring that all items are handled securely and efficiently.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Sort and distribute incoming mail and packages to the appropriate departments and individuals.
* Prepare and process outgoing mail, including letters, packages, and courier services.
* Operate mail sorting equipment and postage meters accurately and efficiently.
* Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing mail.
* Ensure the timely delivery of mail within the organization.
* Keep the mailroom organized and stocked with necessary supplies.
* Report any discrepancies, damaged items, or security concerns to the supervisor.
* Follow all safety protocols and company policies.


**Qualifications:**  

* Prolonged periods of standing and walking.
* Ability to lift and move packages up to 50 pounds.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
* Good organizational and time management skills.
* Proficient in basic computer skills and use of office equipment.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

title: Activity Specialist - Soundview
company: Wediko @ The Home for Little Wanderers
description:
The Home for Little Wanderers is focused on equality and deeply believes in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, and national origin within our staff community. Applicants should be motivated to explore issues of oppression, intersectionality and cultural responsiveness in their direct client-work and in their interactions with the myriad systems that are connected to our roles.

The Activity Spcialist will lead activities with groups of 10-15 children and facilitate after-school programming in an engaging and meaningful manner in one of the following areas:

· Arts

· STEM

· Phys Ed

**Essential Functions**

· Lead hands-on educational, enrichment, sports, and arts activities for groups of 10-15 Elementary school students using project-based learning strategies

· Provide all documentation for NYSED/DOH compliance purposes are prescribed by the Site Manager

· Utilize curriculum to provide lesson plans for all activities in a time and frequency prescribed by the Site Manager

· Prepare materials for the week knowing what materials are needed to be ordered and communicating needs in a timely manner

· Engage in conflict resolution and positive behavior management practices as needed

· Work closely with the site-based team for ongoing coaching and professional development

· Ensure the children’s safety and during program hours in a manner prescribed by the Site Manager

· Positively encourage and support the growth of participating children individually and collectively

· Incorporate The Home core values into all aspects of programming

· Being flexible to facilitate any activity in any space designated

· Participate in ALL staff trainings and activities, including regular check-ins with supervisors

· Work with 21C Program Manager to complete before the start of service the following:

o Complete 15 hours of School Aged Child Care (SACC) License Training

o Complete all School Aged Child Care (SACC) paperwork prior to start of job

**Minimum Job Requirements**

· At least 18 years old with at least one year of college or post high school experience

· Minimum of 2 years of childcare experience with children under the age of 15

· Experience, interest, and desire to work with elementary-school aged youth

· Work and/or educational experience related to child development & leadership

· Knowledge or interest in youth development, group dynamics, and programming

· Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues, high level of patience, and ability to engage appropriately with youth while maintaining professional boundaries

· CPR/First Aid Certification preferred

· Bilingual Spanish preferred

· **Program Dates:** September 2024 through June 2025

· **Work schedule**: Monday through Friday from 1:50pm to 5:30pm in accordance with the NYC DOE calendar. The Home does not operate when schools are closed or on early dismissal days. Mandatory training sessions and meetings will be held each month outside of regular program times.

title: Player Social Marketing Associate (External Agency Staff)
description:
The NFL is currently seeking an associate to join our Player Social Marketing team. This individual will be responsible for supporting Player Social strategy efforts and the larger NFL Social & Influencer Marketing department, including content distribution on game days, supporting internal marketing initiatives, identifying and coordinating social opportunities for players and creators, and serving as a liaison for players, their reps, and internal teams. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of and passion for the National Football League, its member Clubs and Players, and social media.

  


**Responsibilities**


* Identify and distribute relevant and engaging photo and video content to players, with a heavy focus around game day - working Sundays, Monday Night Football, and Thursday Night Football in-office
* Support team ideating content opportunities for players around internal initiatives and event support
* Help manage communication between the Player Social team and the NFL Social Media Programming and LCC teams
* Support ideation and execution of original content opportunities with players and creators
* Work with a team of digital content creators to help produce original social and digital content to be distributed to players and across the NFL ecosystem
* Help create content calendars and recommend best practices for players around the League
* Monitor and evaluate content to help players understand what is and is not working
* Communicate with agents, managers, internal stakeholders, clubs, and player representatives

  


**Required Qualifications**


* 2-4 years social media, content or editorial experience, preferably in sports or entertainment
* Bachelor's Degree preferred
* Strong knowledge in Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Lightroom, and Adobe Premiere Pro
* Extensive knowledge of the current landscape of the NFL and its players
* Highly proficient in developing compelling strategy and recap decks
* Self-starter who can work effectively in a highly matrixed organization
* Ability to multi-task and work in a busy environment
* Detail-oriented individual who executes for success
* Deep understanding of social media platforms including, but not limited to, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, YouTube, and TikTok

  


**Other Key Attributes / Characteristics**


* Experience using social platforms in a professional capacity
* Experience with real-time engagement and analytics tools is preferred
* A demonstrated ability to identify and create engaging social media content as well as recognize and leverage social moments
* Ability to work non-traditional hours, including nights, select holidays, and weekends
* Exceptional attention to detail and organization skills
* Passion for youth culture & technology

  


**Terms / Expected Hours of Work**


* 40 hours/week

  


**Salary / Pay Range**



This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range.

  


*The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success.*


*The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.*

title: CRM Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

The present and future of Audemars Piguet are built on the invaluable contributions of all our talents. Inspired by the wealth of our past, we are excited about the endless possibilities that our future holds. Together, we are resolutely forward-thinking and strive for excellence in all areas of our business.


If this journey inspires you, come chart your own path within our family and let’s continue creating the extraordinary. Together, let's write the next chapter of your career!

 **Job Description**  

The **CRM Manager** is responsible for supporting the development and management of client development strategies for North America. This role will support in establishing clienteling journeys and help to maintain the integrity of the client database and ensure APNA pairs the right client with the right experience. This person must possess a thorough understanding of client segmentation and work cross-functionally with retail network and brand teams to achieve results in a client-centric, luxury retail environment.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


Retail Network CRM Support

* Support retail network with training needs during onboarding and refresher meetings on CRM concepts and strategy
* Act as subject matter expert, developing recommendations for growth of CRM in partnership with APNA CRM team
* Develop and enhance CRM guidebooks for reference
* Reinforce best practices and client KPI’s to support retail network, support the growth of a qualitative database and provide a better understanding of local clients
* Identify and prioritize improvements on our CRM platform through market feedback


CRM Tool Management

* Partner with Head of CRM to ensure a seamless APNA transition to Salesforce across the region in 2024-2025
* Guide the release of CRM Digital Tool enhancements, launches and migrations, including but not limited to AP Calendar, AP Messenger, AP Event App
* Support HQ with the APNA annual newsletter strategy, conduct local testing via Salesforce Marketing Cloud, share results with team


Client Database Integrity & Insight

* Partner with CRM Specialist to pinpoint opportunities to strategically engage clients via insights and engagement tracking
* Partner with Head of CRM to develop CRM dashboards to highlight successes and pinpoint areas of opportunity
* Partner with CRM Analysts to pair client insights with purchasing insights to increase understanding of the client lifecycle and purchasing trends
* Ensure alignment between local CRM team and central teams
* Evaluate database to determine propensity for client interest, loyalty, purchase, and growth in the years ahead

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
* 5+ years of experience with CRM concepts and working with CRM platforms
* Experience with Marketing automation tools and CRM systems, ability to conduct in-depth client data analysis
* Possess a thorough understanding of luxury client and purchasing behaviors across different channels
* Strong organizational and project management skills
* Experience in luxury retail is preferred

  

**Additional Information**  

Audemars Piguet offers a competitive and comprehensive compensation and benefits package. The salary range for this position is $105k-$120k annually. This role is eligible for bonus. Salary will be negotiated based on relevant skills and experience.


Audemars Piguet is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Audemars Piguet hires without regard to age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic characteristics, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage, citizenship, disability, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or any other legally-recognized protected basis prohibited by applicable law.


#LI-EL1
